The Unsevering
Year: 985 - 02
Episode 1 - Episode 2 - Episode 3 - Episode 4 - Episode 5 - Episode 6 - Episode 7 - Episode 8 - Episode 9 - Episode 10 - Episode 11 - Episode 12 - Episode 13 - Episode 14 - Episode 15 - Episode 16 - Episode 17 - Episode 18 - Episode 19 - Episode 20 - Episode 21 - Episode 22 - Episode 23 - Episode 24 - Episode 25 - Episode 26 - Episode 27 - Episode 28 - Episode 29 - Episode 30 - Episode 31 - Episode 32 - Episode 33 - Episode 34 - Episode 35 - Episode 36 - Episode 37 - Episode 38 - Episode 39 - Episode 40 - Episode 41 - Episode 42 - Episode 43 - Episode 44 - Episode 45 - Episode 46 - Episode 47 - Episode 48 - Episode 49 - Episode 50 - Episode 51 - Episode 52 - Episode 53 - Episode 54 - Episode 55
Episode: 1
There is a clew of thread, raveled of a single strand whose beginning is its end.
Moments become wefts and warps that criss-cross into a weave,
and the flow of time spools in a single spot.
??? Go on, read it.
??? Uh... Ryō... shū...?
From the echo of your first cry to the whisper of your last breath,
in the heart of every moment, my eyes catch a glimpse of you.
??? No... That's not how you read those letters...
??? "Yoshihide." That's how you say it.
??? "Ryō-shū!"
??? It's prettier and easier!
Dear lost child of mine, should the way back home elude you...
Follow the thread back to the very first knot that hurt the most.
Where the quivering stops,
that is where you will find me.
Marton Today's the day.
Location: LCE Research Team Lab. Sector
Alyssa Today's the day indeed. Boss, are you—
Hohenheim Hold. Please, don't ask me if I am "nervous." Only ordinary, unremarkable researchers with a particularly low level of confidence in their own material ever get "nervous."
Hohenheim Your unfinished query has reminded me of the last academic assembly—there was this fellow who simply could not stop their hands from shaking with the frequency of 5 oscillations every 3 seconds, even after taking an entire fistful of Tranquility Boluses. What a miserable sight that was.
Hohenheim Oh, of course, perhaps the fear that the attendees may not possess the intelligence to comprehend even half of my presentation may source a reasonable level of anxiety, potent enough to make my legs tremble somewhat. But I have been quite relieved of that concern after you reviewed my materials; if both of you were able to understand it, then the audience should have no problem following the... general narrative.
Marton At least you won't be dosing the audience chock-full of your verbal sedative this time.
Hohenheim On another note... have you any clue as to why our cooperation request for additional research is still pending approval?
Alyssa ... LCA R&D Team has repeatedly denied our request. Apparently, we're to focus solely on our present research...
Hohenheim A rather narrow-minded bunch, aren't they? Do we know specifically who denied our requests?
Alyssa ... The assistant manager who simply could not stop their hands from shaking, even after taking an entire fistful of Tranquility Boluses. It seems pretty obvious that they're still carrying the grudge from when you scoffed at them.
Hohenheim ... Is that so?
Hohenheim Well, they'll have no choice but to approve our request after this presentation. Our present research has already progressed beyond the point of satisfaction, after all.
Alyssa Of course, Boss. Of course...
Hohenheim ... This won't do. Though the motivation behind my additional research request was to sate a personal curiosity, I have no doubts in my mind that it will end up benefiting the company's bottom line.
Hohenheim Marton, do you have our additional research proposal with you? Even the LCA will have no recourse but to approve it once they see the projected gains from its success.
Marton Ah, that... I left it back at the research hall. Didn't think we'd need it today.
Hohenheim A successful outcome of that research should also be able to boost the efficiency of our electrical systems. I'm sure the need for more power is a mutual concern—we already have precious little to spare with how much energy our present research consumes.
Alyssa Yeah, we know. We even had to conduct our experiments in the freezing cold because we rerouted power from the heating system to save electricity. Well, I stayed toasty thanks to my E.G.O gear, but still...
Alyssa Anyways, I'll go grab the proposal. You two should focus on the presentation prep.
Frightened Researcher Re... Requesting support. This is LCE Department, Co... Corridor YS-4. Requesting immediate support. The situation's... a Code... Code... Gah...
??? Apologies. I didn't wish to so unnecessarily cut him off, but... as it seems he passed out... let me be the messenger instead. Though I won't bother with the fancy code-speak...
??? "The situation here is... entirely hopeless."... was probably what he wished to say.
A few hours later...
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
... A good deal of time had passed since we'd said our heartfelt farewells to Jia Xichun, yet we still remained stuck in Hongyuan.
Heathcliff You sure we're settin' off today? Reckon you got the date wrong?
Sinclair I'm pretty sure I didn't... But even Saude's late, and she was supposed to get Vergilius and Pilot...
Outis Right ahead lies the road that leads straight out of Hongyuan. Given Saude's memo telling us to drive out here with a truck, there should be no room for error this time.
Ishmael I sure hope that's the case.
Ishmael When we left Daguanyuan earlier, the guards at the gate actually asked me what time we'd be coming back. They probably think we've taken up permanent residence here at H Corp.
Gregor ... Not surprising. After saying goodbyes left and right, not to mention two farewell banquets—we're still sitting here on our butts without any sign of leaving...
Rodion Exactly. By now, Verg should've appeared out of nowhere with his usual, "Time to move on to our next destination, Dante..." like he always does!
Rodion Then Charon would say, "Off we go, Mephi. Vroom-vroom"... It's been forever since I heard her last!
Hong Lu I don't think there was ever a time Vergilius was gone this long.
Meursault The breach of contract may have led to extra workload for him, but even so, his prolonged absence remains unusual.
Sinclair All this, just because he went out of his way to help us...?
Faust Not necessarily.
Faust While it is true that the penalty incurred from breaching the contract yet remains, the LCC's operation in H Corp., which he was assisting with, was immediately concluded following Jia Xichun's inauguration as the Family Hierarch.
Yi Sang Hmm... I fail to think of any other reason apart from that.
Dante <Vergilius and Charon would always be away whenever we traveled to a new place... but yeah, never for this long.>
Sinclair Maybe he's just off doing whatever he usually does when spending time with Charon...?
Everyone turned to look at Faust.
Faust At this point, there is no information that can be shared regarding Vergilius's absence.
Dante <... Maybe we can ask Vergilius when he gets here?>
Heathcliff You honestly reckon he'd say a word about where he was? That bloke only ever tells us where to go, never where he's off to.
Don Quixote Verily! And never hath he deigned to bring any of us on his ice cream trips... save young Charon!
Don Quixote Hooh! Perchance, his path is that of a culinary journey to sample the unique specialties of each District—
Heathcliff Be serious for one second, lass. This ain't a foodie tour.
Faust ... Aside from guiding our path...
Faust ... it may simply be that Vergilius has a path of his own to walk.
Dante <…….>
I've got no idea what his path would even look like.
We're only here to follow the journey as guided by Vergilius... We know neither the path he has walked, nor the path he seeks to walk.
I wonder if he'll ever share his history with us one day.
Heathcliff I 'spose he's bein' his usual absentee self, but... that don't explain why Saude ain't here, does it?
Heathcliff We've been late plenty of times, yeah. But it ain't like the lass to keep us hangin'.
Rodion Maybe there's been a change of plans?
Outis ... When an operative goes dark without warning...
Outis ... it's usually due to an unforeseen variable, not a change of plans.
As if to prove Outis right, someone forcefully yanks the truck's door open.
Dante <Saude...!>
Rodion Holy— What happened to you?!
Saude stumbled into the truck, short of breath. She was bleeding and covered in wounds both minor and serious—her eyes glistened with wild anxiety.
A broken pistol hung from her waist. It was impossible not to notice the still-fresh gashes and wounds on her.
The first thing that caught my attention, however, was the stump right where her left arm used to be.
Episode: 2
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Saude Prep-prepare for battle, immediately...
Saude I am... no longer able to operate, as you can plainly see... I need... your help.
Saude collapsed to the floor before we even had the chance to ask her if she was okay or what had happened to her arm.
Saude Immediately after rendezvousing with Mister Vergilius... I was... ambushed...
Saude And the attackers... the attackers'll be here any minute.
Where once her resolve had not faltered even in the face of death...
... a grave look of despair now filled her eyes.
Outis How many hostiles?
Saude ... Two.
Saude While Mister Vergilius was dealing with one of them, I...
Rodion Verg was?
Color returned to Rodya's face upon hearing Vergilius's name.
Rodion Well... Then maybe Verg's already on his way back after wiping the floor with both of them?
Saude N... no. I don't think so...
Saude It's Charon...
Saude I... I lost her.
Saude They tore off the arm I was holding onto Charon with...
Saude I never should've let go, I never should've let that happen...
Don Quixote Thou couldst not hold onto young Charon? How, what...?
Saude grimaced, her expression an amalgamation of guilt and confusion.
It was a far cry from her usual, collected self.
Hong Lu ... Did they take Charon hostage?
Saude Yes. I... could not stop them from taking... Charon.
Sinclair What about Pilot...?
Saude .......
Saude Pilot was heavily wounded, but... the last time I saw him, he was conscious.
Ishmael ... We should prepare for battle. Now.
Outis At least our current objective is clear, Executive Manager. First, take out the pursuers, then rescue Charon. While the exact motive of the perpetrators is yet to be revealed...
Saude We may be facing multiple fronts. I briefly picked up a transmission from HQ while running this way, and...
*tzzzzzt*
A sudden buzz of white noise breaks through the truck's silence.
Saude ...!
Saude Ah...
Radio Any station, respond... respond...
Saude froze up, staring at the radio's speaker.
Gregor was the first to act in her place.
Gregor This is LCB, I read you. What's your situation? Over.
Radio HQ Research Facility—
Gregor Research Facility?
Radio U-und-under-attack—
Radio My darling daughter. I hope you've been doing well for yourself out there.
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Radio But don't you think it's about time you stopped playing and came home?
Utter silence descends as a kindly calling cuts off the bloodcurdling scream from the other side.
The voice that came through the radio was nothing short of affectionate.
And... it was easy to guess who the "daughter"... was.
Ryoshu ... Hah.
Ryoshu The Spiders have spun their web, Clock.
Dante <Web?>
Ryoshu And it's woven so intricately that there's no way around it.
That's when I recalled something Lei Heng had mentioned—"The House of Spiders."
Thinking back to how intensely Ryōshū reacted then...
Dante <Do... do you think these attackers have something to do with that, uh... Lei Heng guy from earlier?>
Ryoshu Unlikely.
Ryoshu He was just one of my many passing tutors.
Sinclair Th-then who could've— It's the headquarters, for crying out loud...!
Saude I don't know. The HQ, it's... it's not the kind of place someone can just force their way into...
Saude Breaking into a place like that...? It's completely unthinkable...
Dante <…….>
What now?
Usually, I would use my intuition to choose the best course of action and lead the Sinners during a mission.
But who would've thought that the HQ, which was meant to brief us about that mission in the first place, would come under attack... especially while we were left without a guide?
Ryoshu *puff*
Ryoshu Fine. I didn't expect them to come find me themselves.
Ryoshu Once the spiders have spun their web, they tend to wait for the prey to stumble into it, after all.
The plume of cigarette smoke lingered for a moment before scattering into the air. When I looked at Ryōshū's face, what I saw...
... was an expression of strange euphoria.
Saude …….
Saude Ryōshū, is this all just...
Saude ... some amusing diversion for you?
Saude shot an incredulous look at Ryōshū, who was nonchalantly puffing the rest of her cigarette to ash.
Ryoshu Sure is.
Ryoshu The long-awaited moment has finally found me.
Ryoshu Why wouldn't I be excited?
Saude That's just—
Ryoshu But... don't presume.
Ryoshu My excitement for the coming pleasure... will not interfere with my effectiveness.
Ryoshu I've never once... let enjoyment get in the way of taking the job seriously.
Ryoshu Not ever, not now.
Dante <……>
Ryoshu You said the assailants'll be here soon. Is the one who took the driver coming, too?
Saude ... Charon—
Saude If anything happens to Miss Charon, I...
Saude ... I wouldn't be able to bring myself to face the Red Gaze.
Ryoshu Tsk. This isn't going anywhere.
Ryoshu The Spiders won't hurt the driver.
Ryoshu She's just their bait to lure out the bigger prey.
Ryoshu So stop panicking and set us up. It's unsightly.
Saude ... What?
Ryoshu The Backdoor of this truck. Can it connect us directly to the HQ Research Facility right this instant?
Saude W-wait. It can, but...
Saude To use the Backdoor portal that leads straight to the HQ, I need to verify the security code written specifically for each coordinate. It's... going to take some time.
Ryoshu Heh. Gives us enough time to deal with your pursuer.
As Saude navigated through the vehicle's machinery with her remaining arm...
... the Sinners all began to keep watch on their surroundings, weapons at the ready.
Ishmael So, are we sure it's a good idea for us to head to the HQ? I feel like we're walking ourselves into a trap here...
Sinclair ... What if we requested assistance from Daguanyuan instead?
Outis That can be a solution, yes. However, as this concerns our HQ, resolving this crisis with help from a Wing, even one whose leader we are on good terms with... will require an enormous favor to be repaid.
Outis Your decision, Executive Manager?
Dante <……>
Dante <... We'll head straight to the HQ Research Facility as soon as Saude opens the portal.>
It wasn't hard to intuit that Ryōshū's turn had arrived, given her evident excitement.
If so... the backdoor leading to the HQ, which Ryōshū intends to use, should be the path we're meant to take this time.
Ryoshu Better prepare yourselves.
Ryoshu What awaits us, without a single shred of doubt, is hell...
Ryoshu ... and there in its depths... lies something that has always been waiting for me.
Yi Sang …….
Yi Sang Aught strums above us, walking the vehicle's roof... we have been found.
Heathcliff Oi, then shouldn't we get out of the truck before it caves in over our heads?
Ishmael No. P Corp.'s Singularity protects this truck, remember? Something that's supposed to keep whatever's inside safe. We should just lie low in here until—
Rodion Y-ya sure about that? I can see a teensy crack in the ceiling!
Ishmael A crack? That... makes no sense. The ceiling should be elastic enough to bend under most physical impacts instead of cracking.
Faust ... It is true that the exterior of this vehicular transportation device utilizes P Corp.'s Singularity.
Faust That is why this truck is more spacious inside than it appears from the outside, and has good defenses against external forces.
Faust However, unlike the experimental model we boarded in P Corp., this vehicle appears to be a more... affordable model used flexibly as a shuttle for the Before Team's deployment.
Dante <...?>
Faust That is to say that for a Singularity technology to perform at a competent level, a higher level of investment is required. Budget models—even those of Singularities—can still end up being countered.
Heathcliff So they cheapened out.
Ryoshu Then the assailant is not one of the Nursefathers from the House of Spiders.
Ryoshu If it were one of them... the first shock would have shattered this wall into pieces.
Ryoshu I suppose kicking off with the top dogs would've made for a rather bland story progression.
Sinclair The Nursefathers...? Wait, you mean the same people Lei Heng—
Outis ... We'll have time for speculations later.
Outis Executive Manager, the ceiling's about to cave in!
Dante <... Go for the kill the moment they get inside.>
Dante
??? …….
Outis At the ready, men!
Dante <...! Wait, don't engage!>
Though we were readying ourselves to skewer the intruder the moment he stepped inside...
... we had to immediately backtrack on that idea when we saw who he was carrying.
Saude ... Charon...!
??? She is only unconscious—and breathing still.
Outis I see. You cut Saude's arm off so that you'd have something to track her down with.
??? And she has gone straight to seek help from her comrades...
??? It was indeed a correct decision for us to wait and see how she'd react.
The intruder continued, glancing toward Saude.
As if in response to that, Ryōshū placed her hand...
... on her scabbard.
Dante <... Ryōshū?>
Ryoshu *puff* B.D.O.K. They won't dare hurt the bus driver.
Ryoshu So don't make a fuss, Clock.
Sinclair Huh?! What do you mean she's okay—Ryōshū?!
Ryōshū ignored Sinclair and rushed toward the intruder, her scabbard cleaving through the air.
Ryoshu Oho... parried that, did you?
??? ... Have you no regard for the hostage's life?
Ryoshu You won't dare let her die unless you're planning to incur the red guide's wrath.
Like Ryōshū said, the intruder was only defending himself against her strikes without harming Charon.
Just as the other Sinners were stepping up to join the assault...
??? I had intended to face you one at a time, as the propriety of honorable combat dictates, but...
??? ... unfortunately, since I cannot let you take her back until my master arrives...
The intruder gestured with his hand, and strange, bizarre things dropped through the ceiling with a thump.
??? ... I must resort to using some... borrowed weapons.
Sinclair Are those Distortions or... monsters of some kind?
Dante <No...>
Dante <I think they're... people...>
Heathcliff His "master"... Vergilius is supposed to be handling whoever that is, yeah?
Don Quixote The Color most illustrious must be deterred from wielding his full might, on account of young Charon's capture...
Heathcliff Then we rescue Charon and book it to HQ or wherever—that'll let the guide go all out.
Ishmael Yeah, that seems to be the best shot we have at this moment.
Dante <... Still, let's be careful and prioritize Charon's safety above all else.>
Episode: 3
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Sinclair Ugh... He seized the Backdoor side of the truck. Even if the portal opens, we can't—
Gregor ... Doesn't change what needs to be done. We take care of him, get the bus girlie, and head off to HQ.
Heathcliff For fuck's sake... We can't even fight full out...
Despite Ryōshū's assurance, the Sinners did not share her confidence that no harm would come to Charon...
... so they were confined to fending off the animated corpses, unable to fight aggressively.
Ryōshū was the only one unfazed enough to raise her sword against the assailant in this cramped battlefield.
Location: -1
??? Bothersome little halfwit. Arms straight, I said. How many times... Just how many times must I repeat myself?
??? Oh, stop making a fuss—it couldn't have hurt that much. On your feet. Get off your ass! What makes you think you deserve a break?
??? Quit being a whiny little brat and pick up that sword. Slash straight. See? That wasn't so hard, was it?
??? If I ever hear you whining again... I'll rip your hair clean off your head, so get your act together.
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Ryoshu ... You.
Ryoshu You're no stranger to this sword style.
??? The Palermitan Style. I have been trained in it as well.
Ryoshu Did you learn it from Valencina, that boozehound?
??? I must ask you not to insult her with such a crude epithet. ... My master gave me an order when she imparted this style to me:
??? To temper and hone it until my mastery of it becomes indistinguishable from yours.
??? My swordcraft... is now on par with that of your past self when you still belonged in the House of Spiders.
Ryoshu Learning it without understanding anything... and only obsessively copying me...?
Ryoshu Wasting time over such mimicry... It's beyond ridiculous.
Ryoshu If you're no more than a copycat, then the angle of the wrist, the distance between the feet, the balance of the sword itself—every one of these has to be exact, because even a single incongruity...
Location: -1
Valencina Are you actually that incompetent, or do you enjoy the beating? Maintain your stance!
Valencina Don't bother your stupid little head trying to be clever and just stick to what you’ve been taught! Take what you memorized and move!
Valencina The sooner you become the blade that cuts through all, the better. Only then can I—
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Ryoshu ... will break your form, making your swordsmanship as precarious as a tightrope walk headed straight for a fall.
Ryoshu *puff* You're no different from those wind-up dolls over there.
??? ... Call me a wind-up doll all you want. It doesn't matter.
??? You, likewise, are unable to recall and properly wield the Palermitan Style...
??? Which tells me my usefulness has not yet run its course.
??? I must perfect every form you've been taught, even if I must repeat the same stance a thousand—no, ten thousand—times over...
??? ... if I am to be a perfectly tailored textbook for you.
Ryoshu What if I said I have no need for childish study-aids?
??? Your rejection is inconsequential. My role as your textbook has already begun.
Ryoshu Hah. Then I will illustrate my very own art for you...
Ryoshu ... until you're slashed and cleaved beyond recognition.
Valencina Hah... Damn. My eye's torn up again—Yup, I landed on the right place. That's my Ticket all right.
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Ryoshu Gah...!
Valencina I told you, Lucio.
Valencina You could spend years honing your skills...
Valencina But that still won't be enough to catch up to our Yoshihide.
Lucio .......
The man staggered a little, his head jerking to the side from the impact of the blow.
Valencina Isn't it obvious now that you've seen it yourself?
Valencina How sad and pathetic your progress is.
Valencina This... This is the problem with greenhorns who haven't had a taste of the War... They don't know what it's like to crawl through the muck and grime of the battlefield where the slightest inattention can get your head blown clean off...
Valencina When faced with a superior opponent, don't just rely on brawn, but redirect the force of their attack to the side by locking their arc with the tip of your sword—I've said it time and again.
Valencina And when you're outnumbered, lower your form and draw wide arcs with your sword. Did you forget everything I drilled into you after shouting myself hoarse?
Valencina Secure a corner,
Valencina force them to get to you in a single file...
Valencina Because positioning is everything. Didn't I tell you all of this before?
Valencina If Yoshihide is to recall even one more lesson from me, the textbook can't afford to have any defects.
Lucio ... Forgive me, Master.
Valencina But... you did manage to collect this one as instructed. Maybe you're not completely useless after all.
Hatred thick in her voice, Ryōshū hissed "The Thumb Nursefather..." under her breath as she shifted into a blade-drawing stance against the second assailant.
Ryoshu .......
Valencina Hey. How have you been doing, Ticket?
Valencina Your form's really become a wreck since you were away. Just seeing that sloppy grip makes me sigh. I had to beat that habit out of you back in the day, remember?
Valencina Tch. Still... this reunion's been a long time coming, so I suppose I owe you a bit of courtesy. You're old enough now to understand what I'm saying without me having to resort to the occasional backhand, aren't you?
Ryoshu "Ticket?"
Ryoshu Still intent on calling me that, huh...
Ryoshu ... Clearly, you're still just a sad sack of shit stuck wallowing in a sinkhole of your own making.
Valencina ... Did you just call me... a "sack of shit?"
Valencina Hah... Bitch... you should know your place before barking at your betters.
Valencina ...!
Sensing a sudden presence outside, the so-called Thumb Nursefather snatched Charon into her arms and swiftly assumed a fighting stance.
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Episode: 4
Vergilius *sigh* Manager Dante, it seems that... I must apologize for what has happened today.
Dante <Vergilius...>
Vergilius I was stalled by my personal issues and a certain... unresolved business from the past.
Rodion Verg, you're hurt—
Vergilius They're not from these assailants, so don't worry needlessly.
Vergilius It just so happens that I was involved in a rather... troublesome matter prior to encountering them.
Saude It's all my fault, Red Gaze. I should have... I should have protected her...
Saude's voice trembled as she apologized profusely to Vergilius.
Vergilius No. This happened because I couldn't stop him from going after you.
Vergilius ... And of course, he had to go for your arm.
Vergilius That wound's looking worse by the second. Go get it treated the moment we deal with this situation.
Saude ... I will.
Vergilius met the Thumb Nursefather's gaze head-on.
Vergilius The Thumb... The Finger that makes up for their incompetence with duplicity and cowardice, only to then hide it all behind their mask of honor.
Vergilius You appeared exactly as we received the transmission that the HQ Research Facility was under attack.
Vergilius ... Then your purpose here must be to stall me by any means, even if you have to resort to an old and tired method like taking a hostage.
Valencina Haha! Yes, the way you're reacting to this... I nailed it.
Valencina She's your "cake."
Valencina Remember, Ticket? Remember what I told you when you so immodestly stuffed your face with that cake and smeared cream all over yourself?
Valencina "Smiling like an idiot in such filth makes me want to smash that cake to the floor."
Valencina "So don't you dare let on even a hint of craving for that cake while I'm looking, no matter how sweet and delicious it might be."
Location: -1
Valencina What did I say, Ticket? What did I say?
Valencina If you're gonna start trouble,
Valencina you better not show it on your face!
Valencina Else I'll catch on!
Valencina *huff* *huff* Stop fucking around and tell me straight.
Valencina Tell me. Why are you ^#&@#( $# @!^%#?!
Valencina …….
Valencina Ha. You know what? Be like that. Keep mum and brood in silence all you want.
Valencina That #$#$ #*& $#*@ $#*@ #*$&@&%#... I'll find that $&#*@& $*&#@# @$ &*(##&^*@ ... and I'll split @(# #( @&#$.
Valencina You're not getting past me. You think this eye is just for show?
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Vergilius Well, Valencina, I don't know how much confidence you're putting in that eyeball, but...
Vergilius ... I doubt you'll stall me for long with that half-functioning Relic of yours.
A trickle of blood had begun dribbling down the intruder's cheek from her covered eye...
Valencina Ah, this...?
... but she grinned without a care.
Valencina Oh yeah, it started hurting more and more the closer I got to Ticket.
Valencina But it's gonna get better. Ticket's about to leave this place, you see.
Ryoshu Shithead... you're not here to kill me, are you?
Valencina ... Hah. "Shithead?" Rude bitch, have you forgotten all about manners?
The woman seemed to be having a hard time holding her hand back from striking Ryōshū...
Valencina ... Hmmh.
... but after a few deep breaths, she visibly relaxed and continued on.
Valencina Glad you finally figured that out. Now fuck off as soon as that Backdoor opens.
Valencina The other Nursefathers are waiting for you there, so show some proper manners.
Valencina Oh, or is that brain of yours too messed up to remember who's who and which is which? Why don't you take this time to think of what you're gonna say to them?
Ryoshu …….
Ishmael Hey, hold on. If you're gonna let us go anyway, why don't you let Charon—
Valencina ... Zip it.
The Thumb Nursefather muttered viciously.
Valencina I. Hate. Presumptuous idiots. Who don't know their place. Butting into conversations.
Valencina ... Friends of yours, Ticket?
Ryoshu Yeah.
Valencina That so? Then I don't suppose there's anything wrong with sending them all there...
Valencina After all, why discourage a swarm of flies from flying straight into the web we've spun?
Her eye fixed intently on Vergilius, the Thumb Nursefather slowly backed away from the Backdoor and opened the way for us.
Dante <The Backdoor to the HQ hasn't opened yet. We have to rescue Charon first, then—>
Vergilius Do not hesitate, Dante. That... is indeed the path you must bring the Sinners to.
Vergilius continued coldly, as though he was reading my mind.
Vergilius In fact, you should go through the Backdoor like she says if you want to help Charon.
Vergilius This entire circumstance at the Backdoor has been engineered to hold me, and only me, back. And what awaits beyond the Backdoor... is what they have orchestrated to summon you and Sinner #4 there.
Valencina Correct. I wouldn't want your dash of red...
Valencina ... to snip our elaborate web to pieces.
Saude Portal connection to the HQ... almost established...
Saude But... but every firewall protecting connections to the HQ has been bypassed... What...?
Yi Sang Then, it must be via the defenseless Backdoor, or Backdoors, through which the intruders have broken in.
Saude Portal connection to HQ... established.
Ryoshu Coming with?
Saude ... If Faust goes... I'll be the only one left here who knows how to operate the Backdoor Calibrator.
Saude I'll stay behind... at least until Mister Vergilius rescues Charon.
Ryoshu Then we'll go on ahead.
As always, Ryōshū did not prolong the conversation.
She did not bother to impart even a quick goodbye...
... as she walked into the shadows that awaited us beyond the Corridor.
Dante <…….>
I gave Saude a nod in her stead.
Vergilius Dante.
Vergilius The 4th Sinner's thread is... pulled tautly.
Vergilius It is precariously close to snapping... but it is also sharper than any blade, that it might sever all that it comes into contact with. You must remember that.
Dante <…….>
What kind of "thread" is Vergilius talking about?
Snapping... severing... I wasn't yet sure what exactly he was referring to, but...
Dante <It won't be severed. Not when the chains bind us together.>
I replied, absentmindedly rubbing the area where the chains that connected me to the Sinners had burst out of.
Faust ... Let us proceed, Dante.
With Vergilius's words hanging heavily over us, we made our way into the Backdoor connected to the HQ Research Facility.
Episode: 5
Announcer Arriving at the LCE Department.

The memories came flooding back—researchers jotting down our check-up results on piles of paper, and Hohenheim, with his droopy, tired eyes, leafing through the files.
We'd barely exchanged goodbyes when he rounded up the burnt-out lab staff, who were already pulling their hair out from the sheer level of stress, to oversee another experiment in progress.

Meursault Out of 32 bodies, 26 show identical physical trauma.

Ryōshū cast her gaze down, quietly eyeing her palm.
From the cryptic words and the contemplative look on her face,
I could easily guess that she was taking a trip through the shadows of her past...
... touching an invisible object with her palm and feeling its texture, in search of something that should have been there in her hands.
And I've been through enough to know that we would be revisiting her past together.
However...

What I witnessed was completely different from the memories of the other Sinners I'd seen so far.
Location: -1
The vision I saw was completely fragmented....
... as if a blade had cut up her memories into pieces.
??? .......
Within Ryōshū's memories, something did indeed rest in her palm. However...
I couldn't even make out whether its hue was closer to black or white.
Was it some kind of food? A weapon, or something else entirely?
Even the expression that crossed her face when she saw it and the words that slipped from her lips in that moment escaped me.
??? .......

watching Ryōshū's reaction in complete ease.

Ishmael ... That sure is fishy.

Outis That the enemy may have purposefully unleashed the Abnormalities from the cages as a follow-up measure.
Don Quixote Follow-up measure...? Art thou implying those villains sought to disguise their vile attack?!

Outis It makes more sense that their goal was to delay HQ's main reinforcements and keep them from reaching the scene on time as we did.
Ishmael A delay tactic... I see. Maybe they were looking for something?

Hong Lu Something elusive and so well-hidden that they had to distract us just to buy themselves some time.

Episode: 6
Location: LCE Research Team Lab. Sector

She was one of Hohenheim's researchers who guided us through the regular check-up.

Ishmael ... Okay, Miss Alyssa. Are you...?

Alyssa's hand was grasped around the same, spiral-shaped rod that the bodies in the hallway were holding.

Alyssa The alarm system...

It wasn't just from what was staked through her chest.

Alyssa ... No. It's not... supposed to behave that way... It wasn't...
We waited quietly as Alyssa caught her breath and calmed down.
Alyssa The lights... suddenly died.
Alyssa We thought it was the experiment... we were conducting.
Alyssa Boss groused from... time to time about... how much energy it eats.
Alyssa Hah. Dammit, I should've... noticed then that something... was off.
Alyssa blamed herself to no avail, her voice growing faint.
Alyssa So I thought it was just... a temporary power outage...
Alyssa No one... thought much of it... Because...
Ishmael ... Because it didn't trigger the alarm system. Yeah, it's understandable.
Alyssa I was heading to the Research Hall... to retrieve something, and...
Alyssa That's... when I heard...

Alyssa Not too slow, not too fast... A relaxed but disciplined gait. No one... in our department walks like... that. We're always... so, so busy... that we always walk... in a slight jog.

Alyssa ... before the massacre began. Like... a hellish nightmare that just... wouldn't end.

Faust So, you weren't with Hohenheim or other people when it occurred.

Ryoshu Yeah. This spiral... burrows endlessly to reach the other side, but paradoxically, it cannot punch through all the way. Because it will never arrive at that point.
Location: -1
??? Sweetheart. This... is called a "spiral."
??? Once it is lodged inside the body, even the slightest of movements will make it burrow deeper into the flesh... forcing the victim to remain perfectly still.
??? It may not sting any worse than a prick of a thorn at first, but the more you try to yank it free, the further it drills into the body.
??? But no matter how much it keeps digging in, it will never make it to the other side.
??? The closer it gets to the end, the slower it becomes—it can never meet its endpoint.
??? You know how to unlock it, yes?
??? I'll give you the @#$%#$ once you return with the job done.
??? Remember, if you try to pull it out... without the @#$%#$...

A familiar voice boomed from a loudspeaker, delivering a sharp warning.
Loudspeaker This entire area is laden with security landmines. Even if you somehow manage to get past the minefield, you'll have to face the rest of us. I'm warning you—every one of us in here's combat-ready!

Loudspeaker Hey! That's a Taboo violation, you know? At least try to come up with something actually convincing!
Loudspeaker A-anyways! Turn around and walk away right now or we're gonna bury all of you with us under this facility!
Sinclair We can hear everything, you know...
Faust It is highly probable that the bomb is a bluff. Any bomb that falls under the category of explosives... must be "planted" on an object or surface per the rules set by the Head.
Yi Sang Mm. And that boast of the blast beggars belief. Such a wide radius... is sure to break a bounty of bans and bounds.
Loudspeaker .... Sure, but I wasn't bluffing about the landmines. Take one more step forward... and bolts of overcharged electricity will make barbecue out of you.
As the voice behind the microphone began to grow increasingly irritated, it also became even more familiar. I was pretty sure I'd heard it somewhere before...
Gregor According to Alyssa, Hohenheim should be around here somewhere.
Loudspeaker Wait. Did you just say "Alyssa?"
Faust That voice... It seems we are not mistaken.
Now, I certainly recognized this voice.
A Rather Unwelcoming Voice That voice I would rather not welcome tells me...
A Rather Unwelcoming Voice That these individuals are good to be let through.
Faust That voice Faust would rather not welcome tells Faust that these individuals are good to be approached.
A heavy thunk, and then...
The doors of the Broadcast Sector inched open, but before we could even take a proper look at the people holed up within...
Location: LCE Research Team Broadcast Sector
??? Wha...?! You guys! You should've told us sooner!
Ezra Remember me?
Sinclair Oh! It's Miss Ezra!
We came face-to-face with Ezra, who'd video-called us with a plethora of information on Bloodfiends prior to our mission in La Manchaland.
Ezra Heard you saved the day in La Manchaland!
Ezra And all thanks to yours truly, I bet. So, care to tell me which one's the Bloodfiend Extraordinaire on your team?

The next person to show up was Moses.
I saw her in the video call, too... Team Leader at LCD, if memory serves right.

Ezra I mean, what other choice did I have? We were starting to believe that we were the only survivors out here, and then... bam! A dozen or so footsteps rushing into this sector outta nowhere... We couldn't even check who you guys were because the screens are all busted.
Ezra gestured toward the blank surveillance screens in the Broadcast Sector with her chin.
Ezra For your information, Mister Genius over there is trying to fix the security cameras. He said it's gonna take a while with the power outage, though...
Hohenheim I didn't expect our paths to cross again for anything good, but I certainly never pictured it happening like this.
Underneath the array of monitors Ezra pointed at, we found Hohenheim—looking even more haggard than we remembered—who gave us a faint, unwelcoming nod as he fiddled with a tangle of power circuits.
Marton Hello. I'm relieved to see that there aren't any injured among you.
Marton stepped forth and offered us the greeting Hohenheim chose to skip.
Hohenheim In any case, you say it was Alyssa who let you know of our location? Hmm. If she's not with you, she must be either gravely wounded or already dead.
Ishmael Uh... She's badly hurt, yeah. But we're searching for ways to help her.
Ishmael gave Hohenheim a blanched look as though she was taken aback by his cold certainty regarding his own subordinate's fate.
Hohenheim "Searching," hmm? You talk as if you're playing a game of scavenger hunt.
Hohenheim It might have been better to end her misery then and there.
Heathcliff Wha...? Haven't you seen how we handle things? She's still got a shot. Don't be so quick to throw in the towel.
Marton Please don't misunderstand. Some of these assailants... They seem to enjoy torturing their victims. That's what's keeping our boss on edge...
Marton Boss and I were near the laboratory when the attack started. There weren't many employees around, and the Broadcast Sector happened to be close by.
Marton Probably the only reason we were able to find cover here in one piece.
Don Quixote ... Verily, young Alyssa shall persevere steadfastly.
Don Quixote We have vowed to return and deliver her from death.
Marton ... Thank you. I'm sure Alyssa is... hanging onto your promise.

Ezra Where the heck is he now? I wonder if he's already off to find the attackers...
Moses ... Ezra.
Moses, who had been staring at Outis since we came in, turned her gaze toward Ezra.
Ezra Team Leader! If we can regroup with the Red Gaze, I think we'll have more than enough fighting chance even without our baby bee!
Moses Yes. But... it would seem that the Red Gaze is not here with them.
Moses Just the look on their faces is enough to confirm that.
Ezra Whaaat?! What the heck are you peeps doing here without him?!
Ezra's face immediately soured the moment she realized that Vergilius wasn't with us; her voice crashed over us like that of a host shrieking at uninvited guests barging into her home.
Ishmael It's not like... It's not like we came here on our own because we wanted to...
Gregor Guide bud's held up by an assailant... Ryōshū says she's called the "Thumb Nursefather"... from the House of Spiders...
Moses And probably a tough adversary too... just like those who are assaulting the facility.
Outis ... Her combat prowess is not to be underestimated.
Moses How is she compared to Euryalos of the Argos Unit?
Outis Hmm... Around the same level, I would say...
Outis Wait. You... If you know those names, that means...
Moses didn't grace Outis with a reply. Instead, she closed her eyes, seemingly lost in a brief reverie...
... and soon, returned to the subject at hand as if she were done sorting out her thoughts.
Moses ... Charon—is she taken hostage?
Sinclair Huh? How did you know that...?
Moses You mentioned the attacker in the singular. Perhaps just a slip of the tongue, but I suspect it was a single enemy if not a small number.
Moses Furthermore... Despite coming here without the bus driver, none of you seem particularly convinced that the Red Gaze would be able to quickly dispatch the assailant and join you.
Outis …….
Ezra Give it to our Team Leader! Just one look is enough for her to figure it all out.
Ezra Anyhoo, did you happen to encounter anyone on your way here?
Ishmael Just some peccatula and manikins... Wait a minute. Why don't we get to ask the questions?
Ishmael barely managed to wrest control of the conversation amid the barrage of questions.
Ishmael You're both from LCD. What are you doing here in the HQ where the LCE is?
Ezra Well, about that...
Ezra The LCE was supposed to make an important progress report today.
Ezra Apparently, it's a reeeally important presentation too! We've been receiving bazillions of reminders about how it's a mandatory attendance event and everything... Right, Team Leader? Feels like everyone's overlooking just how reeeally busy our department is!
Hohenheim Sorry to borrow your wording, but it is indeed a reeeally important presentation.
Ezra Yeah, for you maybe. But my department is also reeeally reeeally...
Dante <Hang on... I don't think that's the crux of the matter right now...>
Moses The presentation did not happen. As such, we are unable to assess its importance at the moment.
Moses Whatever is the case, the event was what required us LCD members to be present here at the LCE Department.
Moses And there's one more thing... Allow me to introduce the newest addition to the LCD.
Ezra Yeah, our team has grown in size! Take that!
Moses I was told you'd met before.
A familiar silhouette stepped forward from the opposite side—someone we did not expect to encounter here of all places.
Aeng-du I regret that we must always meet in the midst of plights such as this. I trust you have been well?
Hong Lu Miss Aeng-du! It's been too long.
Hong Lu Is Mister Bamboo-hatted Kim... still in recovery?
Aeng-du Mm. My mentor's flesh... has long since healed, but it will take some time until his mind regains its former tranquility. However long the wait, endure it I must.
Aeng-du I have faith that he will recover in due time. Until then, in silence shall I atone for the transgression I have committed...
... Aeng-du appeared to be referring to how she ran Bamboo-hatted Kim through with her sword under the Monolith's Distorting influence.
Sinclair Still, I'm glad you seem to be adjusting well to life at LCD.
Sinclair caught the shadow flickering across Aeng-du's face and swiftly stepped up to lighten the mood.
Aeng-du I would say I was taken in, but I am deeply grateful regardless. My mentor and I have nowhere left to call home...
Aeng-du But someday... we will...
Aeng-du ... return to S Corp. together.
Ishmael Looks like she's trying her best to fit in too.
Gregor It's always hard to get settled in no matter where you start from.
Moses Now that we've all grown acquainted with one another...
Moses Let us move on to the issue at hand.
Episode: 9
Location: LCE Research Team Broadcast Sector
Moses The first order of business is intelligence sharing, and... deductive reasoning based on the available information.
Moses My team and I were attacked in the hallway connected to the conference hall.
Ezra That guy was... hah, I'll be straight with you guys. Super, super duper strong.
Ezra I would've stood my ground if only Hornet, that dumbass, were here...
Yi Sang By "Hornet," you are referring to...?
Ezra The junior of our team, but he's really, really strong. He's so strong that... uh...
Ezra Ah, I've got it. There was this time when I, uh... what was it again? Some kinda pastry, I think? Anyhoo, I got me some bread to snack on later, and in that split second my back was turned, Hornet, that asshole, swiped it right off of my plate!
Ezra I got so pissed off that I punched him right in his solar plexus to get him to cough it up, and, and... he just went "oof," and... swallowed my bread anyway! Like, does that make any sense to you guys?
Sinclair Uh... yeah, okay... I guess that makes him strong...
Although Ezra's anecdote wasn't very illuminating, none of us bothered to ask for further clarification, as it seemed that the only way to get an objective measure of the Hornet's strength was to let her punch us in the solar plexus as well.
Ishmael So... what's this "Hornet" up to now?
Ishmael peeked around as though she was expecting him to pop out from a hiding spot in the Broadcast Sector.
Ezra Oh, you are going to lose your mind when you hear this! Listen up, what he's—
Moses ... Not yet, Ezra.
Ezra —up to is a s-secret. It's uh... classified stuff.
Ezra trailed off awkwardly.
Moses I tend to analyze my enemies with observation and deduction.
Moses I try to identify their unique colors—the kinds of weapons they use, their methodologies, whether they enjoy the slaughter or avoid it, their attitudes toward battle... all of it.
Moses Once I have that, I can get an idea of when to begin my counterattack, or what kind of weaknesses of theirs I can exploit; and that's how I've usually opened my path forward.
Moses But he...
Moses inhaled sharply as though she missed her smoking pipe, which was nowhere to be seen at this moment.
Moses ... was chaotic. I could not identify a single pattern in his behavior.
Ryoshu He is an empty shell.
Ryoshu His act of killing lacks any emotional touch.
Ryoshu And that... is why you couldn't get a read on him.
Moses ... On the other hand, you... You appear so clearly to me.
Moses You seem so anxious to cut something down, is that correct?
Moses You are broken, shattered; but every shard is keen and transparent... like a hail of small blades.
Moses A glass-like sword of many edges, so fragile with its futile wish to sever away what cannot be severed.
Moses What is it that you grasp so tightly in that scarred hand of yours?
Ryoshu ... Little shit. What are you peeking into?
Ezra Hey, don't talk to our Team Leader like—
Just as Ezra was about to give her a stern warning, Hohenheim stepped in and changed the subject.
Hohenheim To add to that, Marton here and I were in front of the laboratory when it occurred.
Hohenheim At first, it began with the sound of rushing wind. Something large and heavy, cleaving through the air—the kind of sound one should never come to expect from a department like ours, so full of delicate machinery and containment units.
Marton It happened right before my eyes. Something snapped the employee who was walking only a step ahead of me... in half.
Marton And the first thing that came to my mind was this—did an Abnormality breach containment?
Marton But if such were the case, the alarm should've gone off.
Sinclair ... So far, this tracks with what Miss Alyssa told us.
Sinclair She said there wasn't any warning at all before the attack...
Marton Once I got a better look of what that was, I realized that it was neither Abnormality, Peccatulum, nor a Distortion... it was a massive scabbard.
Marton When I looked toward where the scabbard came from, there stood a man who presumably threw the weapon...
Marton ... reading a book like he was out on a stroll.
Moses And the book was...
Ryoshu Matthias... He must've been reading his Book of Vengeance.
Moses First the Thumb, and now the Middle...
Marton I stared at him, still processing what had just happened... when boss grabbed my arm and started running.
Marton I couldn't look back. I heard screaming—from dozens of people, but...
Hohenheim ... You seem to be fond of recounting unnecessary details.
Marton Only after arriving here, at the Broadcast Sector, did I remember that Alyssa was still out there.
Hohenheim When one's life is at risk, the brain instinctively reduces the processing of information to the bare minimum required for survival. It is only natural.
Marton But I was the last person who handled that research proposal, boss.
Hohenheim …….
Marton Alyssa should've been at the conference hall, too. With us.
Rodion Hey, listen. If you wanna look back and nitpick at literally every little thing you did in the past, we're gonna be here forever.
Rodion I know it might sound like a bit of an empty platitude, but... focus on what we can do right now, what we're going to do going forward, okay? You'll have time for regrets later.
Marton ... I suppose so.
Marton You did save my boss once, so... I guess it's only right that I should have more faith in you people than anyone else.
Hohenheim I would like to clarify that the "saving" was but a part of the experiment, but given the urgency, I will forgo a more detailed explanation.
Moses Looks like we're all caught up, then? Good. Now, let's share what we know.
Moses began laying out the situation with the expertise befitting a leader of the LCD.
Moses Today, intruders attacked the LCE department situated in the basement of the HQ.
Moses We lost control of the entire LCE facility, and save for our current location, every sector has been neutralized by a single or a pair of intruders.
Moses Any survivor who's conscious enough to communicate properly is already here.
Moses After the attack, every containment unit was also forcibly unlocked, adding even more fuel to the fire.
Aeng-du We are beset by foes on every side; a search for a foothold is a difficult one indeed.
Ezra Darn, if only these surveillance cameras weren't busted... I'd love to be able to keep track of their whereabouts.
Hohenheim As I have repeated many times today, we are attempting to bring it back to operational status. You speak of restoring a sabotaged power grid like it's a task as simple as wiping one's glasses.
Moses More than anything, we need these two pieces of information at the present.
Moses One: Who are the attackers? Two: What objective brought them to the LCE?
Moses The man we encountered seemed to have a one-track mind, squarely set on killing as ordered.
Moses But there are far too many threads that point toward a motivation more complex than "infiltrate the facility and slaughter its employees with abandon."
Moses's deduction aligned with Outis's—if the assailants' goal was truly nothing more than slaughter, their first order of action should've been to unlock the containment units.
Moses The intruders are... hm, yes. I have enough evidence to at least get a general idea of whom they might be.
Hohenheim Do elaborate.
Moses There's the "Thumb Nursefather" who's stalling the Red Gaze. Then, there's the member of the Middle who attacked the researchers. And we've seen evidence of the Ring's involvement too, given the presence of corpse manikins.
Moses At least two or more Fingers are involved in this attack.
Aeng-du The Thumb...! The vile cur the Kurokumo Clan serves are here...?
Aeng-du Hm, yet this is quite odd. Lady Moses, are the Fingers not hostile against one another?
Aeng-du Those ilk have no business coming within even a sleeve's breadth of each other, save when compelled to attend assemblies such as the Finger Bow-bell, where they oft quarrel to no end.
Moses Correct. But consider this from the opposite perspective—there must be something of enough importance for the officers of each Finger to put aside their differences and work hand-in-hand.
Ryoshu …….
Ryoshu Spiders. Or... the Nursefathers of the House of Spiders.
Ryoshu That's what they're called.
Ryoshu And we've just snared ourselves into the web they spun.
Moses The Fingers... rarely ever cross the line they've drawn between each other. This strange entanglement certainly is a deviation.
Moses "Nursefathers," was it? Seems like a terribly meaningful title to me.
Moses Then it can be presumed that the House of Spiders is a place to... raise something, or someone. To have such high-ranking officers of each Finger gather at one place to nurture someone...
Moses One might think that it hardly makes any sense, and indeed, it doesn't—but what if their purpose itself is just as outrageous? That would, paradoxically, explain how they've come to gather.
Moses Ryōshū, is it? You seem to be inextricably tied to that place.
Ryoshu I.K.W.Y.W.
Sinclair Ah, she just said "I know what you wan—"
Moses Mm, no need. I can understand her abbreviations.
Ryoshu But I can't tell you what I know. Because—
Moses Because it's all broken. The place, the memories attached to it... I can see how they've shattered.
Ryoshu …….
Moses You don't have to recall everything. All I need to know is what that "outrageous purpose" is. What is it?
Ryoshu Me.
Ryoshu To forge me into a blade that cuts through all.
Ryoshu But I left that place behind.
Dante <Ryōshū, can you tell us anything more?>
Ryoshu ... Shame, but that's all I have, Clock.
Ryoshu I don't remember much more than that. Even if I did, it's not an easy thing to speak of.
Ryōshū let out a protracted sigh just as Moses did earlier, the long exhalation of someone who clearly craved a puff of smoke. It betrayed the aloofness she projected.
Come to think of it, Ryōshū hasn't been smoking at all since we got here. Or... maybe since the truck.
Ryoshu ... Clock, like she said, and... like what you've seen, my mind is a mess.
Ryoshu I have questions of my own, but the answers elude me.
Ryoshu But maybe the pieces can be put together using your hints, like the one you gave me earlier.
Ryoshu So we have to solve this together, this puzzle... or this game of escape room.
Ryōshū muttered placidly.
Moses …….
Moses If it is you the House of Spiders wants, then I must ask you to entertain this question: why did they bother attacking the HQ?
Ryoshu Oh?
As Moses began her explanation, Ryōshū looked in her direction with mild amusement.
Moses When you said you "left" the House of Spiders, I presume you meant you "escaped" it.
Moses Members of different Fingers are hardly the kind of people to fraternize even on a good day, but this alliance of sorts they call the House of Spiders has persisted even after your departure. At a glance, it may only appear that they were simply waiting for your return.
Moses But given their... behaviors today, they don't strike me as a particularly patient group as a whole.
Moses In other words, I find it suspicious that they decided to act now. If they were desperate, they would've made the move long ago.
Moses This leads me to believe that... they were waiting for the right time.
Moses Whichever is their motive, Ryōshū—whether it is getting you back, or doing something else—the fact remains that they have chosen this particular moment to act.
Hong Lu The Nursefather of the House of Spiders we encountered, she... made way for us so that Ryōshū could come to the HQ Research Facility.
Hong Lu She harbored such intense and complicated feelings for Ryōshū, but...
Hong Lu ... I don't think I got any sense that she was trying to kill or take Ryōshū with her.
Ryoshu But she said that the Nursefathers were waiting for me here.
Ryoshu Clearly, they're here to see me, Weirdo Detective.
Ezra Alright you— Hey, what the hell's your problem?
Hohenheim Be calm, please. It is best that we do not interrupt their conversation.
Aeng-du In intense dialogue shall they find and draw out the answer... let us not dare stem this course.
Moses It is a fair assumption that the Nursefathers of the House of Spiders have attacked this place to provoke you. However...
Moses ... I can't seem to shake the thought that they must have a distinct objective.
Moses If they were indeed after Ryōshū and only Ryōshū, then... choosing this specific time and place hardly seems to serve that purpose.
Dante <The intervals between each of the Sinners are different, but...>
Dante <... once a Sinner's "turn" ends, another's begins. Every single time, without failure.>
Dante <This case has everything to do with Ryōshū. I believe, without a shred of doubt, that it's her turn.>
Moses Hm.
Once the Sinners relayed my words, Moses fell into a brief contemplation and began to mutter a sequence of words.
Moses Limbus Company. The Mirror. The Glass Window. The former L Corp. Extracted E.G.O. Enkephalin. Psychoments. Abnormalities. Monolith. Sinner Ryōshū.
Moses I can't think of too many things in the LCE Research Facility that could be what the House of Spiders is after.
Moses By process of elimination, the only reasonable answer that can be deduced is as follows:
Moses They're here for the Golden Boughs.
Hohenheim ... So that's how it is.
Dante <…….>
Dante <Moses is right. It's become very important for us to look into Ryōshū's past, to reach in and see what lies there, but...>
Dante <... LCB's goal, its journeys, and its stories have always been bound to the same terminus. Obtaining the Golden Boughs.>
Dante <Hohenheim... where are the Golden Boughs in this facility located?>
Faust The manager would like to know the location of the Golden Boughs.
Hohenheim It's at a laboratory in this facility.
Hohenheim's gaze turned to me.
Perhaps he was looking at the clock hands on my head.
Hohenheim ... Very well. I suppose there's no way around sharing the contents of our presentation.
Hohenheim's answer sounded more like a prolonged sigh.
Hohenheim It was... a presentation regarding our progress in the Golden Bough experimentation.
Faust …….
Hohenheim And the limited group of individuals with the clearance to access the contents of that presentation... does not include members of the LCB.
Heathcliff ... Oi, aren't we the ones riskin' our necks out there to collect those boughs? How come we're not allowed to—
Hohenheim I am not the one who decides the scope of our security.
Faust Hohenheim, your concern is understandable.
Faust The company maintains tight control over any information regarding the Golden Boughs.
Faust There is no way to know, at this moment, what the consequences of leaking this information without the company's explicit consent might be. If the worse comes to worst, we may even be subject to... a memory wipe procedure.
Outis Unbelievable. We're stalled by some red tape at an exigent circumstance like this?
Hohenheim What do you expect from a company practically built on secrecy and suspicion?
Hohenheim Anyway, assuming the risks of divulging this information are understood and accepted by all parties present, let me get straight to the point. The Golden Boughs, we were... hm. We were experimenting with grafting the retrieved boughs onto one another.
Yi Sang Grafting the boughs...
Yi Sang Then, was the purpose to combine the boughs to form a singular tree?
Hohenheim …….
Hohenheim Nothing slips by a fellow researcher, I suppose.
Hohenheim Correct.
Hohenheim We are incubating the Golden Boughs under a very special environment... to create a sapling. We haven't yet managed to graft them together into a proper tree, no—but that horizon is in sight.
Hohenheim Today was the day that we were to share the successes of the experiment with certain major characters and teams within the company... until this happened.
Outis The Golden Boughs are at the laboratory, hm...
Ishmael Then, we have to get to the laboratory before they do and secure the Golden Boughs.
Rodion But... we can't just waltz out on our own when this whole place might be crawling with enemies, right? Is there any way we can get in touch with the HQ right now?
Outis Did HQ even receive your support request?
Hohenheim We did send a rescue signal to HQ an hour ago, but we have no way of knowing whether it was received. The attackers destroyed all of our outgoing transmitters earlier.
Outis As long as they received a signal, any signal, it shouldn't take long until they recognize that the LCE is under attack by an overwhelming force.
Outis Assuming that the LCA has sent us support units, do we have an estimate of how long it might take for them to arrive?
Faust ... Even if they have to navigate around inaccessible passages currently present in the facility...
Faust ... it should be no more than 10 minutes.
Outis 10 minutes? Then they should've been here already.
Faust They have either failed to receive the transmission, or the power outage has trapped the reinforcements in the elevators.
Gregor Hm, yeah... If it weren't for Miss Saude bringing us up to speed, we wouldn't have thought of using the Backdoor to come straight to this facility.
Hohenheim If such is the case, then we need only reboot the power divider in the Facility Management Room.
Ezra Heya, Mister Big Brain. If we wanna restore this department from a shutdown state, we gotta take out all the Distortions and Abnormalities sauntering about, right?
Hohenheim ... In order to perfectly restore the facility, yes. This place has been designed to be quarantined from every other Department if even a single Abnormality has escaped to its hallways.
Ezra Eh, no use sitting around putting our heads together then, right? Hey, if you guys are scared of some Abnormality or Distortion, leave it to us! We'll kick their butts.
Ishmael Nobody said they're scared. I'm just saying, we could benefit from practicing a bit of caution.
Hohenheim It would be wisest to prioritize restoring power to the facility. It seems that these attackers are making effective use of the dark.
Outis ... I see.
Outis Executive Manager. I am of the opinion that we must split our forces in order to facilitate our operation, given the urgency of the situation.
Outis The situation looks rather pressing for us to sit here and waste time debating what to tackle first.
Once I nodded in agreement, Outis quickly took control of the situation.
Outis Listen up, men. We prepare for two things: reconnaissance and extraction.
Rodion Huhh...? Extraction? You mean escape?
Outis Assuming that the LCA's support will arrive, it would serve us best to move in tandem with them to improve our chances of launching a joint attack with numerical advantage over our enemies.
Outis Also, we have to stay mobile—we've held this position for too long. Our enemies will methodically kill and comb through the entire facility until they find what they're looking for. The more we remain stationary, the more likely we are to encounter them, and that will only elevate the risk of total obliteration.
Heathcliff Makes sense. Besides, the others here ain't like us. Once they get killed, it's over for them.
Outis Another thing—don't forget that we have to reach the Golden Boughs before our enemies do. Whichever we end up prioritizing, we won't get anything done by staying holed up in here.
Hohenheim Very well... Then, if we were all to leave this place at the same time, where should we prioritize? We have many pressing tasks, as you have explained. Golden Bough retrieval, facility power restoration...
Marton But the Facility Management Room to restore power to the facility, the laboratory, and the area with the damaged circuitry are all located far from each other...
Outis ... We divide and conquer.
Outis Securing the Golden Bough, restoring power, and suppressing Abnormalities to clear a path for the reinforcements... they're all equally important, and must be resolved concomitantly. And to do so, we must split up into squads based on our expertise.
Ezra Yeah, alrighty. We work better as a separate unit anyway.
Outis The LCB will be in charge of securing the Golden Bough, as our Executive Manager here has the ability to detect it whenever they are in proximity to one of them.
Ezra Ooh, kinda like a metal detector?
Outis How dare you compare the Executive Manager to a—hmph... I'll let that one slide, given the urgency.
Outis Anyway, we would like to leave Abnormality, Distortion, and Peccatula suppression to the LCD.
Ezra Gotcha~ That's totally our bread and butter!
Moses How many... difficult Abnormalities or Distortions did you have contained in this facility?
Hohenheim Combatants of your prowess should have no trouble suppressing most of them—save for 2, however, that might pose some trouble.
Hohenheim Take these microcommunicators with you; we use these to communicate between laboratories. While it has limited range, it should be useful enough for relaying the suppression tactic for each entity you come across.
Outis Perfect, we've secured a means of communication.
Outis As for restoring power to the facility, I would like to designate that task to the LCE personnel here. I presume you are best acquainted with the layout of this facility out of all of us?
Hohenheim A reasonable choice. The layout of this facility is more complicated than it might have first appeared to you.
Faust That is indeed one way to describe abysmal cable management.
Hohenheim ... Please, consider it but a representation of the entropic escalation phenomenon. Despite the way it looks, the setup is quite stable.
Marton gave a handful of tiny radios to Outis, who distributed them to each of us.
Outis Very well. Don't forget to keep each other updated.
Moses …….
Moses The acrid stench of smoke I'd much rather leave buried in the past... keeps coming back.
Episode: 10
Location: LCE Research Team Hallway
Hohenheim Don't forget. The Golden Boughs are kept within a preservation container. Take extra care when you handle it...
Gregor Okay, okay. We've been working our butts off to retrieve those shiny twigs, too. We know enough about their worth not to throw them around willy-nilly.
Gregor's comment did nothing to deter Hohenheim, who kept voicing his warning again and again.
Ezra Alright... Lab's that way... and the Facility Management Room is...
Ezra was tracing the available routes to guide the LCD team members who arrived with Moses...
... while others crept down the corridor, alert for any dangers lurking in the shadows.
Rodion W-what was that?
Ezra There's a wall dropping down... Huh...? Hey! Watch out, you guys!
The corridor was thrown into complete chaos.
Ishmael Sinclair! This way!
Sinclair Huh...? I can't... It's too far...!
Dante <Is everyone alright?>
Meursault It would seem that a quarantine system designed for Abnormality containment breaches has just been activated.
Meursault, who had been standing close by, replied in a monotonous voice.
And just as he said, when I looked around...
Gregor That was close... That wall nearly flattened us into pancakes.
Yi Sang We were but a breadth away from disaster.
Ryoshu ... Shabby thing.
Dante <Uh...>
Ryoshu What a W.O.T.
Just when I didn't think it could get any worse, it did.
Sinclair Waste... Of... Time... Where's Ryōshū, by the way?!
Don Quixote Manager Esquire!! Where art thou?!
Sinclair and Don Quixote were desperately calling out from the other side of the wall...
Hong Lu Hey, I think this is the first time we've ever been so completely separated from Dante.
Rodion Ugh. Then we can't even afford to get hurt.
Ishmael I don't see any Abnormalities around...
Marton Now they've taken over the security wall controls, too... They've effectively forced us to split up.
Outis ... Not to worry, Executive Manager. This is only a minor setback. Allow me to assume command of this unit for the time being.
Ishmael Hello? That's the first thing you're worried about? Shouldn't you be more concerned about Dante...?
Hohenheim ... This has grown to be quite the predicament.
Hohenheim let out a heavy sigh.
Ezra Are you alright, Team Leader?
Moses I am. At least we have no injured among us.
After all that planning, we ended up getting separated into completely random teams.
Moses ... Let's first check who we have on each side.
Dante <Okay... It's me, Meursault, Gregor, and Yi Sang here. Also Ryōshū.>
Ezra We've got... the Detective, Miss Aeng-du, and me over here. And, uh...
Hong Lu ... Ishmael, Rodya, and me. Outis, too.
Hohenheim As for us... Marton, the Assistant, LCE team members... and the rest.
Don Quixote "The rest?" Of whom speakest thou?
Faust It is a phrase used by individuals who find it especially difficult to acknowledge their betters.
Sinclair ... Me, Don Quixote, and Faust.
There was no chance we could get the security wall out of our way even with our combined effort.
Marton Hmm... the master keycard doesn't work, either. It should be able to override the lockdown, but...
Even the LCE wasn't having any luck on their side...
Outis There has been a minor deviation... But it can't be helped. Advance according to plan.
Outis This unit, the LCD included, will neutralize any hostiles within the facility—one threat at a time.
Marton We'll assist you with finding the trail as soon as we're done repairing the security cameras.
Outis Acknowledged. The LCE and Hohenheim's team will secure the Facility Management Room and prioritize restoring power...
Outis As for the Executive Manager's team, proceed to the laboratory for Golden Bough retrieval.
Rodion Ugh... Figures I'd end up in the team doing the fighting... What a pain... *sigh*
Ezra Alrighty, off we go~!
Outis I will take the lead. The rest of you, follow me.
And with that, Outis and the LCD team's footsteps faded into the distance on the opposite side...
Hohenheim We should get moving, too. Although I think just Marton and my Assistant here will be enough to restore power to the Facility Management Room.
Faust There seems to be a lack of proper structure in the generation and distribution of electricity here. It is regrettable that the facility lacks a backup mechanism to handle unforeseen emergencies of this sort.
Hohenheim With the breadth of my responsibilities, it is only natural that I would have been too busy to be responsible for the facility's design... However, when viewed independently, the structure of the laboratory itself is—
Heathcliff *sigh*
Don Quixote Fret thyself not over so trifling a matter, young Heathcliff!
Sinclair She's right. With the three of us together, we'll be able to overcome whatever obstacle that gets in our way... Probably...
The voices of Hohenheim and the other Sinners also slipped further away into the background.

Gregor Let us know if you sense the Golden Bough, Manager Bud.
Dante <Okay.>
Gregor Heh, the two smokers of the group ended up in the same team... What are the odds?
Ryoshu .......
Gregor I'll never know how the others manage to pull through these working conditions without taking a puff...
Meursault Mm.
Meursault There was a time when I partook. But I could not find any reason to maintain the habit.
Gregor Oh? There was? What did you smoke?
Meursault Most things that fall under the category of "cigarette."
Gregor Huh... After a whole year of watching you never walk out of line, I pegged you as one helluva straight-laced fella.
Meursault I partook in both categories of activities—those generally accepted as right, and those accepted as wrong.
Yi Sang During my time among the old League of Nine Littérateurs, I once had an opportunity to engage in a few "hits" of the substance at the behest of my fellows.
Yi Sang That was the one and only time. Everyone burst into laughter, though I found no enjoyment in smoking itself.
Gregor Hah... That's always the case for first-timers. Must've been pretty intense, huh?
Yi Sang What about you, Miss Ryōshū? When did you first start smoking cigarettes?
Every pair of eyes searched Ryōshū's face,
but she didn't bother telling us her story, nor did she reveal any signs of unease or anxiety.
What we saw on her face was inexplicable exhilaration, thrill, and as strange as it may seem, a fury chilling to the marrows.
Ryoshu ... Beats me.
Ryoshu I've always been surrounded by cigarette smoke, ever since I was a brat.
Gregor ... *inhale* Wouldn't have guessed it any other way.
Gregor It's your turn this time, isn't it?
Ryoshu Yeah. So damn obvious that it makes me scoff.
Yi Sang …….
Yi Sang How do you feel, Miss Ryōshū?
Yi Sang To be faced with the past that stands before you?
Ryoshu Simple...
Ryoshu It's exciting.
Ryoshu *scoff* All that waiting finally paid off.
Gregor I noticed you haven't smoked one since... this whole thing began, Ryōshū.
Ryoshu Right.
Ryoshu Trying to get used to... staying off it.

Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Valencina Red Gaze. Never thought you of all people would have one.

Valencina Not that I don't understand. To have an unwanted burden you can't even push aside or kill off shoved into your care... I know what it's like all too well.

Location: -1
??? Dearest daughter of ours,
??? please pay close attention to the way the line curves.
??? From ribs, we can make blades keener than any sword; from femurs, we can make bludgeons sturdier than any mace.
??? The thoracic cage has taken this prepossessing yet hardy shape of an arch to keep the heart and the lungs from harm.
??? Preserve this natural beauty of the human corpus and do not infringe upon its primeval, precise value...
??? That is the reverence with which the act of creation must be handled—just as musicians handle a priceless instrument.
??? Touch it, if you will. Do your fingertips feel the contour of a blade along the grains of musculature, its tendons and sinews?
Yoshihide …….
Yoshihide The bones of the one most desperate for life... have become a blade best fit to reap it.
??? Indeed it has, hasn't it? I knew from the fathoms of my heart that you could appreciate the true value of this piece, Yoshihide.
??? The care put into this piece I have so painstakingly birthed into the world is greater than that of any other work of mine. The smallest fracture or imbalance could instantly render it useless.
??? Once this piece is complete, dearest Yoshihide, I would like for you to wield it.
Yoshihide I will.

Episode: 12
Location: LCE Research Team Hallway
Meursault The elevator up ahead is operational.
I could see the light of the elevator beyond the lockdown door.

Dante <If power has returned to the elevators...>

Dante <Ah! Then—>
Once the elevator doors opened, LCA agents began pouring into the facility in perfect order.
They immediately began hacking and shooting down anything that got in their way. There wasn't the slightest hesitation in their movements, as though drilled into them over countless rehearsals.
From the way they never failed to deliver a killing blow to any target that so much as twitched, even when it was already mangled beyond recognition, I could tell they were seasoned veterans with years of combat experience.
I began to grow certain that these fighters could brush aside any obstacle we faced with ease.
Gregor LCA special operations unit, was it? They sure know how to clear a room.

... 3 LCA agents who were advancing while covering the front of their squad simultaneously fell to the floor without so much as a scream.

Location: LCE Research Team Hallway

At first, the shadow stretched into the sharp tip of a pick...
... then after several more flickers, it took on the familiar outline of an axe, very much resembling Rodya's own.

What Alyssa had described earlier was becoming more and more apparent to us.
Dante <A relaxed but disciplined gait...>
The man, after having slaughtered dozens of LCA agents... slowly turned around to face us, his sharp dress shoes lazily clopping against the floor.
He seemed to have been aware of our presence from the get-go.
Light dances across the glossy surface of his white mask.

Location: LCE Research Team Laboratory
If the assailants were indeed after the Golden Bough... what could they possibly want with it?

I was deeply engrossed in my thoughts when I noticed that Ryōshū had stopped in her tracks.
