Even in the cloying darkness of the unlit lab, Ryōshū seemed to notice something out of place.
Gregor You smell something...? I don't smell anything other than your cig—
Ryoshu …….
Gregor ... Oh, yeah. You've not been smoking for a... hot minute.
Only silence welcomed us in the lab.
We couldn't hear any breathing, but there it was without a doubt—the stink of cigarettes and a chilling, disembodied sense of dread we couldn't exactly put our finger on.
Ryoshu …….
Ryoshu When I left that place...
Ryoshu I remember feeling a strong contempt for someone.
Ryoshu It had to have been...
Ryōshū started muttering as though she was gripped by the chill.
I noticed she wasn't speaking to me, though. It seemed as though she was wading through a bog of mutilated memories to cling to her emotions at that moment.
Location: -1
Yoshihide Dihui Star(地慧星), you...
Yoshihide All along, you've wanted to make me suffer to the bitter end, haven't you?
Dihui Star What audacity. You think I'm the one making you suffer, Yoshihide?
Dihui Star You do realize that you've always been the one obstacle in my life, don't you?
Dihui Star This is the only way for us to get even.
Dihui Star Yoshihide, it...
Dihui Star It never stops.
Dihui Star The sound of the fetter around my feet, rusted and heavy... How it clinks and rattles...
In that vision of the past, Ryōshū raises her sword in an agonizingly slow motion, unsheathing the blade that we have never seen revealed before—
—A white blade of such unfeeling purity, devoid of even a trace of mercy beneath its pale edge.
In the split second I was blinded by the glint of the blade...
... Ryōshū clutched the hooded figure's jaw in her crushing grip.
Then, without a moment's hesitation, she drove the blindingly bright sword into the figure's mouth.
Dihui Star Gah... *hack*
Dihui Star *huff* Hrrk...
Ryōshū pulled the sword out in a single swift motion.
Dihui Star *splat*
The figure coughed out a thick glob of blood and a piece of her sliced tongue.
Dihui Star Hah...
Dihui Star Hah! Ha... haha... Haha!
But she spat out more than just the bloody chunk of flesh. A guffaw hacked its way out of her mouth...
The triumphant laughter of one who had just seized the victory of one's life.
With a deep, ragged breath, Ryōshū let the sword fall from her grip.
She stood rooted in her spot, staring at the flailing figure with a look of pure confusion.
Location: LCE Research Team Laboratory
Ryoshu ... I.S.O.T.P.I.T.A.
Ryoshu Insidious Stench Of The Past... In The Air.
And right now, right before Ryōshū's eyes...
The vivid presence from the memories of the past came to life in the form of a white silhouette,
her hand slowly brushing the lips beyond which no tongue laid, as if to remember the absence of the organ that Ryōshū had so mercilessly cut off...
Like a lone watchman who had been keeping vigil, awaiting our arrival.
Dihui Star …….
Dihui Star ... Ha.
The mouth that lost its tongue faced Ryōshū without opening even once.
But I think I heard a whisper of a hollow sigh escaping between her lips.
Ryoshu Because of my five "fathers"... I had to leave behind the single most important thing in this world.
Ryoshu And that is why...
Ryoshu I must take it back.
??? So happy to see you again, Ryōshū. I mean it.
??? ... Such were the words my master bade me to relay.
Ryoshu ... The Pinky Nursefather.
??? As my master... expects naught from my insignificant self...
??? I am but a blade rusting amid the quiet turn of nature, doomed to ever endure the dullness of todays and the emptiness of morrows.
??? And therein, owing to your pursuit of the spider's thread...
??? I am once again granted a chance to carry out my master's will.
Ryoshu ... Another talker. Piss off.
As her apprentice approached us, Ryōshū's "Nursefather" slowly stepped away...
... toward where the container of Golden Boughs lay nestled, emanating a soft glow.
??? ... The preparations are complete. I trust you have not forgotten the plan?

Episode: 15
Location: LCE Research Team Laboratory
Ren Refrain from any deviations from the plan... Has my humble self neglected to impress upon this matter many times?

Ren This plan involves no outward expression of such selfish desires.
Albina The "plan" that involves only the observation of the warming, reddening flesh while our own heartbeats slow...
Albina That plan isn't to Fascia's liking. Her tendons have tightened.

Feeling a dull pain squeezing through the grooves of my mind, I turned toward the spot from which the sensation surged forth...
Ryoshu …….
... and saw Ryōshū standing there.
In her eyes burned hatred and fury, a glare that would easily have had me believe that she would unsheathe the sword from her back at any minute.
At the receiving end of that glare...
Dihui Star …….
... was the veiled figure, who'd been watching our battle without a word.
The Pinky's Nursefather... simply stood there, meeting Ryōshū's wrathful gaze as she did in the fragmented memories.
Then, she withdrew into the shadows, the darkness slowly eating away at her shape...
... before disappearing from our sights.
Yi Sang Dante, have you found the Golden Boughs? We must—
Dante <No...>
Dante <We were too late.>
I felt the dull pain in my head lift as I pointed at where the veiled person stood.

What remained in their place...
Location: -1
... were dozens of cigarette butts, the same kind that Ryōshū smoked, piled up like a thick layer of dust.

Location: Somewhere in the House of Spiders, Past

Dihui Star How does it feel to be a living fetter?

Dihui Star I am... barred from enjoying the fresh air of the world outside,
Dihui Star no longer free to travel the mountains and cliffs as my feet would carry me... as the other members of the Pinky are.
Dihui Star I wish to no avail that I should be allowed to weave the delineations of Wings and Backstreets.
Yoshihide I don't understand... what you mean.
Dihui Star You don't? I'm saying I did not endure my grueling life only to be trapped here as your Nursefather.
Dihui Star Well? What do you make of it, Yoshihide?
Yoshihide *sniffle*
Dihui Star Stifle your crying. What makes you think you have the right to shed tears?
Dihui Star If anyone has a reason to cry, it is me.
Dihui Star Ever since you were pushed into my care, not a day has passed without me wanting to cry.
Yoshihide My knees...
Yoshihide Momm—Mother, I scraped... my knees...
Dihui Star Keep your bawling out of my sight.
Dihui Star Snotty, sniveling little brat... Disgusting. You wouldn't have gotten hurt if you weren't such a slow dullard.
Dihui Star Next time, keep your eyes open and dodge before it hits.
Dihui Star Maybe... maybe if you had a leg ripped away from you...

Dihui Star Then you'd also taste a drop of this crippling agony of imprisonment.
Location: LCE Research Team Laboratory, Some time ago

??? Yet in the end, Yoshihide... It is thanks to her...

The man blocked the Ring Apprentice's blow as though it were a performance meant for Ryōshū.

We made our escape through another route while the Ring and the Pinky Apprentices were busy fighting each other.
Location: LCE Research Team Hallway
Gregor That technique he used... was that hers? The Pinky Nursefather?
Ryoshu ... Yeah.
Ryoshu It was one of my gouged-out memories, but clashing blades with him reawakened it.

Ryoshu That Pinky woman, too... she sure hated me all right, but that didn't stop her from teaching me what she knew.
Ryoshu ... Probably to make me a more prolific, more efficient killer.
Ryoshu And that's why losing me was such a harrowing failure for them. All the work they poured into me slipped right through their fingers when I left the spiderweb.
Gregor Hmm... Well, love-hate can play out in all sorts of ways, I guess.
Yi Sang Your memories... did you hew them away yourself?
Ryoshu Yeah. With my own hands.
I was reminded of the expression I saw on Ryōshū's face in one of her memory fragments.
When she sliced off the Pinky Nursefather's tongue...
When she drove the blade she never unsheathed before us into that woman's mouth...
What I saw on Ryōshū was the expression of suffering.
Ryoshu Every time I draw this blade and cut something...
Ryoshu I'm also slicing away a piece of my mind.
Ryoshu That's the reason I didn't want to use this blade.
Ryoshu But had I not done so, they'd have taken her away from me for good.
The one last thing Ryōshū didn't want to let go.
The word that came out of Lei Heng's mouth the moment he saw her.
Dante <Your baby...>
It was for her that Ryōshū sliced off both her own memories and the Pinky Nursefather's tongue.
Ryoshu ... My blood, my ward... my daughter.

Ryoshu Yeah. In a place only I know. In a safe... that nobody else can find.
Dante <What was your daughter to you?>
Ryoshu ... Don't see why I should play coy at this point.
Ryoshu The one and only... precious thing.
Ryoshu She's all I have.
Even without her memories, Ryōshū spoke without any doubt.
I caught myself thinking how nice it must be to have such certainty.
Dante <... I see. As long as we can stick to this path, we'll all eventually find the things we lost.>
Ryoshu Right. I know that.
Dante <C'mon, let's go after them. With the elevator still busted, they can't have escaped to a different floor just yet.>
Dante <The Golden Bough... It's faint, but I can still sense its presence.>

The two LCE researchers sighed anxiously as we hurried in the elevator's direction.

At Ryōshū's brusque order, Ravi shrank back awkwardly, his expression turning a little abashed.
Normally, Gregor and Yi Sang would've given Ryōshū a verbal nudge or two for being so rude to someone we'd just met, but as things were...
They simply watched on as Ravi stepped back and casually moved forward to fill his spot.
Gregor Alright, Sora, why don't you come walk with me and talk shop? We're not nearly as well-versed in Workshop gear as you'd think.

Ravi But why...?
Yi Sang Ahh, I am pleased that you share our enthusiasm, Dante! Come—between the three of us, I am quite hopeful that we should be able to engage in an academic discussion of unfathomable depths.
I found myself suddenly swept into Yi Sang's somewhat awkward and hastily improvised academic symposium, trailing a pace behind Gregor and Sora.
Sora You're all so kind... Th-thank you for being so nice to me.
Sora I like n-nice people. My coworkers aren't like that, s-so I tend to feel left out a lot. I'm p-pretty sure they'll chew me out again for spacing out and falling behind.
Gregor C'mon. There's no way they'd treat a surviving researcher that badly after what you went through. It's not like you botched an important mission or anything, right? I'd say you're in the clear.
Dante <That's true enough...>
Gregor's words brought me back to all the plans we'd messed up—Saude's plans, more precisely—and left a tinge of regret in my mind.
Sora Ah, th-they must be your leader.
Ryoshu You're bad at reading people.
Dante <... Are you saying I'm not leader material?>
Ryoshu Heh. I'm saying you're more than just a "leader."
... I couldn't really imagine Ryōshū meant what she said, but I nodded anyway.
Yi Sang Mm. I concur.

But despite the distance, these invisible chains that bound me and the Sinners had never once been severed.
Even when they were killed, departing to a place I couldn't follow, I always managed to reach past the searing gates of hellfire and bring them back through the impossible.

The moment we became certain that the Index Nursefather was gone, the Sinners all collapsed to the ground with a collective, exhausted sigh.
Whenever we'd encountered him, he had never once averted his eyes from Ryōshū as though the rest of us posed no threat against him.
Replaying his words in our minds, the nonchalance with which he invited Ryōshū to come back home...
We let the silence he left behind wash over us, overwhelmed by the sheer monumentality of the task before us.
Episode: 31
Location: LCE Research Team Elevator
Dante <... What is that?>
Yi Sang He has left something behind.
Yi Sang It appears to be a... safe.
Ryoshu ...!
Ryōshū hurried toward the safe left behind by the Index Nursefather.
She kneeled before the locked safe, and placed her trembling hands over it...
... before reaching out to its door with such tenderness that she seemed completely different from the person who'd just made a mad dash toward it a few seconds ago.
Her hand was bumpy with old, rough, but distinct scars.
And some of those scars that never fully healed were...
... were numbers—numbers that made her eyes flit desperately between the skin where they were etched and the safe. Trembling, Ryōshū opens the rusty door.
The tiny space inside, where a child was supposed to be waiting for her mother's return...
... was empty, as though someone had carved out a piece of reality from the world.
Strength seemed to drain out of Ryōshū's hand as the fingers that tightly gripped around the door's handle fell limp.
As though the sheer weight of the emptiness spread from the tip of her fingers into every part of her body.
Ryoshu Araya.
Dante <... Ryōshū!>
We...
We all heard the name that slipped between Ryōshū's lips like a dying whisper.
It was the name of the child whom she was supposed to find in there.
But before we could ask her more about Araya...
... Ryōshū fell to the ground, unconscious.

Episode: 33
Location: Corridor of the Ring
Hohenheim If I might just add one more thing—you needn't try to comfort us over our conversation, Manager Saude. Consider this nothing more than harmless, humorous banter among us researchers.

Ishmael Well...

Ishmael We've still got a lot of people in the LCB who don't know where they're going in life, don't we? Like how I used to be.
Ishmael You know, with how Dante seems to feel a lot of pressure over their responsibilities, I guess you could say that I've sorta committed myself to sharing a bit of their load and helping the team navigate through the trials of our journey and... <size=80%>you know, all that stuff...</size>
Ishmael So, I'm just trying to put on a brave face, at the end of the day. Someone needs to, right? To reassure everyone that it's all going to be okay.

Faust While there is no doubt that Faust does indeed know it all...
Faust ... there were times when I also found myself grasping at straws,
Faust unable to make even the simplest decisions—whether I should move forward, whether I should stop, or whether I should go back the way I came.
Faust And that made me realize anew...
Faust ... Faust is but a name that may leave at any time.
Sinclair .......
Hohenheim ... Well, I suppose it is my turn in this heart-to-heart roundtable. I'm not quite fond of these last-minute barings of one's soul as though we're walking to our collective death, but... if this should help raise the chance of our success by alleviating some of your concerns, then I see no reason not to participate.
Hohenheim My superiors have... repeatedly refused to authorize the plan that includes me as a combatant for this mission.
Hohenheim I understand their logic.
Hohenheim Sending a research-specialized employee to near-certain death would indeed be an inefficient management of human resources, from the corporate perspective.
Hohenheim Instead of accepting my request, they suggested that I take some time off. 3 months, give or take.
Hohenheim They said everything will have returned to normal by the time I sauntered back into the office; that the LCE's job was to find normalcy again while LCA or LCB dealt with the consequences.
Hohenheim It was a tempting offer, I must admit. Research was indeed an endeavor in which l could lose myself while the rest of the world slipped by.
Hohenheim I would take the 3-month vacation, return to the lab and bury myself in research after research, and... eventually, it'd really have been like nothing had happened.
Hohenheim New employees would be hired to fill the vacancies with remarkable immediacy as though there had never been any loss of personnel in the first place.
Hohenheim So yesterday, as I was arranging the office for my absence, I opened one of my desk drawers, and—
Alyssa Oh. You really were gonna go on a vacation...
Hohenheim ... And I saw our next year's research proposal peeking out from the middle of the paper pile.
Hohenheim It's a funny thing, the way that corporate planning works.
Hohenheim No one knows what the future holds, but they expect us to plan months ahead in our proposals.
Hohenheim When I'd written that research proposal, I'd planned it to be a collaborative research between me, Marton, and Alyssa.
Hohenheim And now, I'll have to erase Marton's name, one by one, from dozens of its pages.
Ishmael So... How did you manage to convince the higher-ups?
Hohenheim My third request to have me included in this mission was accompanied by a resignation letter. A binary option, if you will—they had to choose one over the other.
Ishmael Uh... you can do that?
Hohenheim Who's to say that I can't?
Radio That last subject wasn't much about anxiety at all, but... has that helped calm your nerves at least, Sinclair?
Sinclair ... I'm a bit better, I think.
Radio That's good. Then let's all take a deep breath, and... commence operation.
Radio Enemy incoming.
Albina Sorry I'm late. Fascia was enjoying a nice nap, so I had to wake her up first.
Albina She was heartbroken by how far behind schedule we were in her completion.
Albina It's because of Zenon's Tortoise Spiral.
Albina People struck with that weapon often end up with, quite literally, broken hearts... depriving us of the core ingredient.
Albina So, I'm glad we're able to meet here. None of you have replaced yourself with a prosthetic body... and I won't be using the Spiral.
Sinclair ... You knew we'd be coming?
Albina Mmhm. The Maestro asked me to go out and receive our guests.
Albina Do you know of the Maestro's shattered child? She would've been a wonderful big sister for Fascia. I'm yet to reach that level of creation, unfortunately. You see, collecting ingredients without damaging them is still a bit tough for me.
Albina So, I hoped to get some practice and started by cutting off my own arm. After all, whose body do we know better than our very own?
Albina But the corpus of others is still so challenging to work with. Which finger do they put the most pressure on when using their arms? Do they let their wrists handle much of the pressure, or their entire arm? Do they have any preexisting defects that may change how I interact with the medium? So, so many things to take into account before getting to the actual work.
Albina ... Speaking of which, would you be so kind as to hear my request?
Albina How about we spend some time to get to know each other... and become friends?
Sinclair Friends?
Albina Mhm.
Albina It's not so hard to become friends.
Albina Sora told me that becoming friends is as simple as sharing the things we love, our hobbies, our dreams... Though I didn't become friends with her, as I wasn't planning on using Sora as an ingredient for Fascia.
Albina So... Ah, I know where to begin. Would you share something you love with me, everyone?
Sinclair .......
Albina Don't hesitate to ask me anything you'd like to know about me, either. Ever since I fed a few slices of my brain to Fascia, I've become a very, very bad liar.
Sinclair ... What makes you think... we're going to tell you any of that?
Albina Okay, then me first. My name is Albina. I'm learning Corporism art under Maestro Callisto's tutelage with my beloved Fascia.

Callisto An unbreakable bond that remains unsevered, even as death comes to bear the subject away in its gentle embrace... I find such values utterly noble.

Episode: 35

The Index Nursefather caressed the smooth surface of his mask.
Rien Seeing you here... it makes my face burn and ache.

Ryōshū asked in a quiet voice, as though she couldn't care less about anything else he had to say.

Location: Corridor of the Index, Past
Rien "... and that's how it was. Then, the monkey said—"
Yoshihide .......
Yoshihide Dad, I'm 13.
Rien What's that, sweetheart? But I thought you were still 5!
Yoshihide .......
Rien I'm only joking. I don't suppose you found that very funny.
Rien Of course, I know you're 13 years and 7 months old.
Yoshihide Yeah. Way past picture books...
Rien And who says you can't read fairytales once you're past a certain age?
Yoshihide Here, literally. It says "For ages 3~8."
Rien That's just a recommendation, sweetie.
Rien I read nothing but these picture books myself.
Yoshihide ... You're weird. I thought adults didn't read picture books.
Rien That's an unfair preconception constructed by grown-ups who take too much pride in being able to read books without pictures.
Rien How are we to know only from words...
Rien ... the shape of the monkey's eyes, their colors... what the animal looks like when it laughs?
Rien That's why I become so anxious whenever I read parts unaccompanied by pictures.
Rien Afraid that my imagination may be different from the reality the author had defined.
Rien And you, sweetie...
Rien ... you like these books too, don't you?
Yoshihide ... I don't hate them.
Yoshihide Can we just move on to the next page? What happens to the monkey?
Rien .......
Rien Let's stop here today and pick up next time.

Valencina I had to beat that girl head to toe more than a few times before any fire sparked in her eyes.

Valencina You see, this one doesn't cry.
Valencina Lucio, stop limping around. That wound's nothing serious.
Lucio Yes, Master.

Lucio My master was generous enough to take me, a vagrant with nothing to my name, under her wing. She fed me warm food and put a roof over my head. I would've ended up in a corpse pile somewhere in the Backstreets without her help.
Lucio Which is why... it is only right that I obey her with all my heart.
Heathcliff Huh...
Valencina That's right. It's pointless to question and think. Just do exactly as you're told—exactly as I taught you.
Valencina It's the one thing you're good at, isn't it?

Episode: 42
Location: Corridor of the Ring, Past
Callisto So, what do you think, Yoshihide? This concept is called "Minimalism."
Callisto A bold removal of the unnecessary for the preservation of the essence.
Callisto As you must be aware, the human corpus has far too many non-essential parts which harm the purity of it.
Terrified Victim I'm scared...
Terrified Victim Father... Where... are you...
Yoshihide Dad...
Yoshihide This is just too cruel... I don't wanna see it...!
Yoshihide .......
Callisto Yoshihide, that is because you are focusing only on the present. Allow yourself to look beyond the subject's momentary suffering—and there you will discover the perpetuity of the structure we will shape from it.
Callisto Let us review. The simplicity with which a straight line sunders is a primordial form of structuralism.
Callisto I will raise you as a precious pupil of mine, a companion to all of my future artwork. So please, Yoshihide—follow along with my classes.
Callisto To reveal the beautiful, original form of the human corpus to the world, the skin must be removed, and the spine severed. That approach, however, runs the risk of being far too safe with the composition.
Callisto After all, art is a culmination of moments and choices, and the suffering therein... Yoshihide, will you impart your impression of this piece, how it appears in your eyes...?
Yoshihide I'd say my tastes lean closer to...
Yoshihide ... the appreciation of the negative space. Not this kind of butchershop job.
Callisto Butchershop, Yoshihide? I was simply hoping to replicate the striking visual imagery of Fauvism.
Dying Victim Nngh... Do you have any idea who I am?! I'm—I'm—!
Yoshihide Her squealing's getting... real grating.
Yoshihide I prefer my canvases quiet.
Callisto Ah, you are finally enlightened enough to engage with me in a discourse of tastes.
Callisto I'm so happy, Yoshihide...
Callisto Perhaps you will evolve beyond simply learning the art movements created by the other Maestros of the Ring, and...
Callisto ... found an art movement of your own someday.
Location: Corridor of the Ring
Callisto How I miss those days.
Alyssa Nngh...
Callisto While we certainly had conflicting subjectivities when it came to our tastes... I helped to form the structure and the intellectual framework through which Yoshihide's unique aesthetic sense and her exceptional eye for artistic beauty could thrive.
Ishmael Alyssa...!
Hohenheim .......
Alyssa Agh... nngh... It... hurts... so much...

Callisto Most of them have... fragile, thin bones that break far too easily.
Callisto True strength comes in the form of agility and the patience to find an opening.
Callisto The body does not lie, after all.
Callisto Refer to my manikins for more elaboration on that subject. But I've already expounded enough upon the core of the matter.
Sinclair ... It's about whether... all of their senses are alive...
Callisto Precisely.

Alyssa Hnngh...
Radio It's time... to leave that burning village, Sinclair.
Radio Let's leave that painful memory in the past.
Sinclair The past...
Callisto What sparked your wrath?

Alyssa Why...
Alyssa If you were just after the Golden Bough, why...
Alyssa ... did you have to kill them?
Callisto Ah, camaraderie. Even your motivation is ugly.
Callisto To ask "why" the House of Spiders hunts is akin to asking someone why they exist.
Callisto I do not get angry. Anger makes things drab and monotonous. So, I will now proceed to elevate you into artistic completion.
Hohenheim ... What a meaningful piece of art. Truly.
Callisto Pardon?
Hohenheim But if I were to add a few words of advice...
Hohenheim I think your work is rather uninspired.
Callisto .......
Ishmael Hohenheim, what are you—
Ishmael .......
Ishmael Right. I'll use the Ampule on Faust and get her back on her feet if I can find an opening. The manager has to be... occupied with something else.
Hohenheim Though I may not look the part, I like to think I have seen far beyond my share of corpses.
Hohenheim It's nothing to be proud of, but I've spent years at a company full of these... "Abnormalities."
Hohenheim Many of which employed methods of killing my fellow staff that showed far greater artistic merit and depth than anything you have prepared here.
Hohenheim Let me think... ah, of course.
Hohenheim There was this employee who took on the role of the protagonist, staging quite a poignant play.
Hohenheim Their role was to slit the throat of the Captain they respected most, parade their lifeless torso around for 2 hours, and confess their sins to whomever they came across.
Hohenheim I watched the play from beginning to end, comforted only by the fact that I was never really that close with that individual. Because once a play had begun, the audience had to watch it to its curtain call.
Callisto You... have my attention.
Callisto Is there something you would like to impart about this... artwork I am working on?
Hohenheim A few things.
Hohenheim One, you're not making full use of your medium.
Hohenheim What you show me now is no different from one of those cursory autopsy reports I can find lying around in my office.
Hohenheim Your work can be boiled down to simply cutting open a corpus and rearranging its organs in neat order. I do recall, quite vaguely, some Abnormalities with neither originality nor creativity—much like this piece you're working on.
Callisto .......
Hohenheim And you've drained too much blood, far more than what is necessary. That limits the spectrum of color in your piece.
Hohenheim On a more positive note, the element I found most compelling upon closer inspection was the contrasting duet of veins and arteries. It is the kind of expression achievable only through a refined understanding of the human anatomy and its workings.
Callisto Ah...!
Callisto So you noticed it after all! That detail alone demanded more than 3 days of devoted labor, yet it failed to resonate with any audience—even with Albina!
Hohenheim Every artist craves the understanding of others. Art for art's sake is without meaning.
Callisto Yes, yes. That is what I was here for. To create a revolutionary artwork, something to move people... and to observe them.
Callisto But the others were still so attached to their hollow ambitions and ties to the secular world that they did not even pretend to understand my creations...
Callisto I have harsh words especially for Valencina, for always pickling her body in alcohol, stumbling into my space and almost destroying my work.
Callisto As for Rien... he is merely a self-inflicted imitation—no more than a simulacrum that mimics, at the behest of the Prescript, the fate of a certain Fixer in the Library...
Callisto Fuhu... I suppose I've gotten ahead of myself in all this excitement. Please do excuse my faux pas.
Callisto Returning to the subject at hand... If you were to work on this piece, how would you add the missing artistic element?
Hohenheim ... The fasciculus of humans, when desiccated in an oxygen-deprived environment for days, begins to emanate a faint glow.
Hohenheim Perhaps you could use that as half-decent decoration.
Hohenheim Another thing—don't trap yourself in a box thinking that macabre violence and the exhibition thereof is all there is to art. Make your art tell a story that is unique to you.
Hohenheim An example:
Hohenheim While the rest of my body is unremarkable, I am the individual with the most remarkably genius brain in this company.
Hohenheim How about this? Split open my skull to reveal the brain underneath, and let that be your finishing touch. I hear that knowledge and the number of folds in one's brain have a direct correlation. This would be a good opportunity for me to observe that.
Hohenheim As you must be aware, compared to other organs, the brain is highly complex and fickle to work with. I assure you, it will be a good challenge.
Callisto Yes, I agree... the harder the material is to work with, the more exciting it becomes when I've finally tamed it as my own...
Callisto Now... Come closer, and speak your name to me.
Hohenheim ... Hohenheim.
Hohenheim I have never been so ashamed of my own name.
Sinclair S-stop, Mister Hohenheim...
Sinclair W-what are you even trying to do?
Sinclair We're all too hurt to do anything. Faust, Ishmael, and me...
Hohenheim Well... my best, I suppose.
Sinclair But—
Hohenheim I am well aware. My gear and weapon are... utterly inadequate to defeat a man of such strength.
Hohenheim But what matters is that I am determined to never regret anything, ever again.
Hohenheim Besides, there are moments when gambling may yield a rather fascinating outcome.
Sinclair Remember... at the check-up? My placement in your scale of power was...
Sinclair I... I'm just not strong enough... I can't turn this situation around...
Hohenheim Stop thinking in numbers. Forget those rankings.
Hohenheim One may come to mistake numbers as the ultimate truth of the world, as something that interweaves both rationality and analysis; however, the numbers themselves are but conduits by which we may physically realize and translate the abstract into the present reality.
Sinclair The present...
Callisto It is time, dear Hohenheim.
Callisto Thank you. Thank you for understanding me.
Callisto I will preserve and cherish you until the day I am gone.
Hohenheim Yes, and... while this may be an unnecessary concern, I would prefer it if you could avoid wearing something like that... wide-brimmed hat of yours.
Callisto Ah, this hat?
Callisto A long, long time ago, I wished to delve into the depths of the physical manifestation of my mind. Then, I realized that my skills were yet too immature to attempt such a thing... and bound it together once again.
Hohenheim Aha, so the hat is a kind of helmet or a brace, as the wound never fully closed...
Hohenheim And here I thought it was some horribly ill-conceived fashion choice.
Callisto And what significance does it bear in your present circumstance?
Hohenheim Well, I was hoping that...
Hohenheim ... I should be able to inflict some degree of damage with my surprise attack.
Hohenheim How is it? I don't suppose you saw that coming.
Hohenheim It is an E.G.O called "Diffraction"—extracted from a particularly tricky Abnormality.
Hohenheim I'm curious if you ever learned the lesson that there's always more to reality than what meets the eye... or that the really important things are invisible to the eye.
Callisto ........
Albina Maestro!
Callisto ... My amygdala is shaking. The corpus amygdaloideum is connected to the brainstem, which is involved in the brain’s emotional centers.
Callisto Ah... when Yoshihide shattered that sword of mine so long ago...

Callisto Oh, you're the one who suddenly collapsed in the Research Facility, aren't you?
Callisto While wrath may indeed force your body to function beyond its breaking point... even that has its limits.
Callisto 83% of your body has been heavily damaged. At that level, even properly wielding your weapon becomes a challenge.
Callisto The corpus works in immaculate ways indeed. Every cause and effect is crystal clear.
Sinclair Dante... if you're watching... do something—please, do something...!

Sinclair ... Get off me.
Callisto There are faster ways, indeed. But I would prefer to choke the air out of him...
Callisto ... because asphyxiation is the most appropriate approach to ensure that the subject suffers for as long as possible without leaving any damage to the corpus.
Hohenheim *choke*

Albina He is demonstrating his act of creation before all of us...
Albina Now, let us both become audience to this rare opportunity. Keep your eyes peeled to the end.

Sinclair The future...
Sinclair ... Suffusing within me...
Sinclair ... is a scent...
Sinclair A stench...
Callisto ... I beg your pardon? My gallery boasts a perfect balance of temperature and humidity for the preservation of artworks. They are isolated from external contaminants at all times.

Sinclair I see...

Episode: 43
Location: Corridor of the Ring
Hohenheim .......

Sinclair The awakening and the summoning occurred simultaneously.

Sinclair Ah... no, not every Sign has this power. This is the power of my Sign.

Sinclair .......

Faust ... But it will not be impossible.
Sinclair No. It will be a difficult path, still. Almost unbearably so.
Sinclair Now, I find myself thinking that...
Sinclair ... maybe the journey I've walked my entire life, everything I've gone through as I trudged across the fields of battle... was merely an offshoot event of an offshoot world—designed to end here and now, to serve this very moment and nothing more.
Hohenheim All has been cast into the realm of speculation, now.
Sinclair Correct. But if I can be a strength to myself, then I best accept that fate.
Sinclair I wish certain others were here, too. So I could see everyone I'd been longing to see... just one more time.
Sinclair Every now and then, I find myself thinking back... to the days I spent aboard that bus.
Sinclair Those memories... might be the only things that keep me going in the days to come.
Ishmael .......
Sinclair I should leave now. Before the longing gets worse.
Sinclair I might be returned to where I came from, but perhaps this is simply the end of the road for me, like death. Neither you nor I will know whether this is how I die. Still...
Sinclair Even if this is where I end... even if my entire existence boils down to serving this moment and nothing more...
Sinclair ... I'm glad I got to spend my last moments with you guys, instead of being surrounded by dying comrades. And that's good enough for me.
Sinclair Oh, and Miss Faust?
Sinclair Don't grieve everything all at once.
Sinclair That's the only advice I have for you.
Faust .......
Hohenheim I don't suppose the promise of a reunion will mean anything.
Sinclair Even if my Sign were to burn again, there's no telling whether it'll be "me" again next time. Because there's...
Hohenheim ... No guarantee.
Hohenheim Well, I don't think you've... changed much, at least from what I can see.
Hohenheim Ah, though it seems you've grown a bit taller.
Sinclair So I have.
Hohenheim Thank you. It couldn't have been easy.

Episode: 45
Location: ??? of the Thumb
Gregor Gah...!
Valencina I know about insects like you better than anyone.
Valencina Poor little pests that gave up their human limbs for something infinitely more revolting.
Valencina G Corp.'s pride and joy—their pest weaponry.
Valencina They had three stand-out successes, from what I recall.
Valencina The Maggot Prince... the Moth Princess... and the Lord of Flies.
Gregor .......
Valencina Those three really put on a stomach-churning show in the front lines of the Smoke War. I've got 'em to thank for toughenin' up my resilience against gross shit.
Valencina But there was this rumor then, almost as unbelievable as an urban legend.
Valencina That G Corp. had one more, yet-to-be-seen fourth weapon.
Valencina That one supposedly got stuck mid-hatch and failed to even break out of its husk.
Valencina One look at that hairy, chitinous arm tells me everything I need to know.
Valencina While no one's ever known what that entity looked like, probably because no one survived the encounter to tell the tale...
Valencina Well, it would've been a different story had it met me...
Valencina ...but everyone had an idea of what insect that might be.
Valencina There's the Maggot... the Moth... and the Fly... There's one conspicuously missing vermin from that list, isn't there?
Valencina Looks like I've found the poor cockroach that never managed to hatch himself.
Gregor Ngh... Right...
Gregor ... You said you were a veteran of the Smoke War, too...
Valencina Oh, yeah. Good ol' Smoke War and its many, many unforgettable memories. Though I'm sure losers like you wouldn't agree.
Valencina The Smoke... the viscous organic fluids... the mist that tainted every breath of air...
Valencina That day, I proudly wielded the bayonetted rifle bestowed upon me by La Famiglia Bognatelli.
Valencina You know the sound you vermin make? That loud buzz of your bug wings?
Valencina That noise was like a sound cue that let me know where to aim, bullet in the chamber.
Valencina Whenever I'd hear that noise, I'd aim there, stab the vermin right in its heart, then... bang!
Valencina Oh, here's another war story of mine.
Valencina It's about this little guy who managed to dodge last minute to the side. The shot missed its heart, but was still a hit. Guess even bugs have survival instincts.
Valencina Anyway, the vermin fell to the ground from the shock and curled up into a ball, all frozen up.
Valencina A sight more pathetic than roadkill.
Valencina Wanna hear what I did to it next?
Valencina I wanted to have some fun. Took my sweet time and broke its legs one by one with the butt of my rifle.
Valencina 4 limbs would've ended the fun too quickly, oh yes. Luckily, this one had 6.
Gregor …….
Valencina Leg 1 goes, and it fights back. Screaming.
Valencina Leg 2 goes, and it starts to crawl away from me. On its belly, with its remaining legs.
Valencina Leg 3 goes, and it starts bawling. Drool and snot and what have you streaming down its face, doing something that looked like pleading, I think.
Valencina And, heh heh... oh boy, you'll want to hear this part. Leg 5 goes, and it just goes limp like it's dead.
Valencina It doesn't even try to run. It just... goes still and waits.
Valencina And that's my favorite moment, really. The state of complete capitulation, having discarded even its will to live. Letting me do whatever I want to its body...
Valencina But you can't possibly have the cheek to call me cruel.

hacked into pieces, mutilated; time itself howls with a piercing cry.

Rien so I made a new one.

Rien so I got married and raised a child.
Rien Then another day, the Prescript told me that someone would be killed right before my eyes, and that I was to do nothing but watch it happen.
Rien And so, I waited... without lifting a finger.
Rien Even in their final moments, my wife and child never understood why I simply watched it happen to them.
Ryoshu And you just... accepted that?
Rien Hmm... Do you think I shouldn't have?
Rien Darling, remember that story about a spider that wanted to leave its web?
Rien Unsatisfied with merely gazing upon the sky, it wished to be free of its webs.
Rien Seeing that, a long-lived chrysalis, who was as wise as it was old, told the Spider....
Rien ... to circle its web 3,000 times. If nothing changes, another 3,000 times. Another set should nothing change still.
Rien Round and round, the hopeful spider circled its web more times than it could count, yet even after thousands of repetitions... all it saw was the same old web.
Rien The spider, full of despair, went to confront the chrysalis, who had now metamorphosed into a butterfly. "I have circled my web countless times," it said. "Why hasn't anything changed?"
Rien Flying off into the distance, the butterfly answered:
Rien "Resign yourself to the fact that you are forever bound to the web, and close your heart to the beautiful sky above until it ceases to stir any feelings in you."
Rien "That is the only way to be truly free of the web."
Rien My darling daughter, you'll end up losing everything if you let yourself be shackled by what gives you these feelings—happiness, wrath, sorrow, joy... Because once you get a taste of them, you'll learn the truth that to live is to suffer.
Rien That is why I must remain in the House of Spiders.
Location: The House of Spiders Rooftop
Rien ... If I let you go here, you will never come home again.
Rien I could force you to stay, but I'd get nothing out of it.

Rien Sweetie, all would be well if you'd just stay. The House of Spiders doesn't have to disappear.
Rien So please... don't leave.
Episode: 54
Location: A Beach, Once Upon a Time
!@#*%$ Dad, why do sea waves keep crying?
Rien Because they're sad that they're knocking over the sand castles.
!@#*%$ Then they should just not knock them over.
Rien Waves move with the winds. When the wind blows, the high and low tides can't help but knock down everything in their path.
!@#*%$ Then why not just... push back when the wind blows?
Rien Think about it this way, darling.
Rien The waves... built those sand castles only because the wind pulled them in.
Rien And now, the wind is pushing them to bring the castles down.
Rien So the waves really have no reason to feel sad.
!@#*%$ Then, Dad...
!@#*%$ ... when will they be happy?
Location: Corridor of the Index, Past
Yoshihide ... when will they be happy?
Rien …….
Rien Well... Let's take our time finding that out, shall we?
Rien We can save the ending... for later.
Rien We'll read all these endings together once you grow up and become as old as Daddy.
Yoshihide ... Okay.
Yoshihide Then you gotta read to me every day.
Yoshihide Pinky promise!
Location: The House of Spiders Rooftop
Rien ... I hear the waves.
Ryoshu ... How do they sound?
Rien ... ly.
Rien They sound lonely.
Episode: 55
The company had much to do in the aftermath of the incident.
Saude took an indefinite leave of absence.
Alyssa went into the long-term recovery ward.
Marton's remains were placed in the morgue for LCE casualties.
Hohenheim, as usual, went off with a shrug and a half-hearted wave of the hand. We never got to talk to him properly about all that's happened.
There were many other victims we couldn't name individually.
The Index Nursefather vanished without a trace and couldn't be located, but with the machinations of the House of Spiders foiled, the company seemed to have decided that he's no longer a serious threat...
... and proceeded to call off the manhunt.
And on that burned rooftop,
a red schoolbag was recovered, bearing a name tag filled out in a child's clumsy handwriting...
... with the Golden Boughs safely nestled within.
Location: LCCB Transporter Truck
Ryoshu *puff*
Ryōshū started smoking again.
Any trace of Araya's existence was completely erased from her mind, and there was, at present, no way to restore them.
Perhaps Ryōshū herself knew of the loss—that something had flowed out of her and disappeared.
But to what extent? I had no way of telling.
She didn't ask why the scabbard of her sword looked different.
So instead of asking if she was all right, I just...
I just chatted her up.
Dante <Looks like... we managed to safely retrieve the Golden Boughs once again.>
Ryoshu Right.
Dante <How do you feel about it, Ryōshū?>
Ryoshu …….
Ryoshu Well, at least it wasn't SAD. ... I mean, it was alright, NGL.
Sinclair Oh, you mean it wasn't Such A Disappoin—huh?
Sinclair Whoa, Ryōshū! I've heard the other one before, ha ha.
Ryoshu …….
Ryoshu This is B.A.H.
Sinclair Seriously?
Ryoshu Yeah, that's better. I'll switch back.
Sinclair Do you hate compliments or something? Oh, don't tell me. You're not switching back because I liked it, are you? Are you?
Faust "Entanglement"...
Faust ... is a connection that transcends space, distance, and any attempt at conceptualization.
Faust Thus, so long as one half of the connection exists, nothing, probabilistically, can be said to have entered a state of complete decay.
Faust As long as its trace wanders the City, it will eventually...
Faust Resurface.
Dante <Does that mean...>
Faust Yes. So long as the scabbard remains in existence...
Dante <And as long as the Bus keeps moving...>
I'll keep turning the clock.
Location: -1
And when I do, we'll all be seeing the same starry sky.
The stars that no longer exist in the City swirl around us like a vortex.
Every time I revive the Sinners, Ryōshū, too, will exist in that moment...
... to be reunited with what is forgotten but cannot be lost—her only daughter, Araya.
Location: ???
Rien Yoshi... hide... You've finally learned... how to wield Arayashiki...
Rien And by learning to wield that Relic... you've just made yourself the most important sword to the Fingers... at the next Finger Bow-bell...
Rien ... The home that can protect you... is gone now.
Rien So... take care, sweetheart.
Location: Somewhere in the City
Rien …….
Proxy Rien...
Proxy Killing me won't be the end of it...
Proxy The Proxies... will never stop hunting you down.
Proxy Lurking in the muck of this reeking cesspit... won't keep you hidden forever...
Rien Haah... *cough* *cough*
Rien Oh, dear... I'll need to... dye my hair again.
Rien ... I'm supposed to recite this?
Rien "I have nothing but my sorrow, and I want..."
Rien Hah... This is tiresome.
Rien Ha...
Rien Haha...
Rien Hahahahaha!!
Rien Sweetheart... Looks like...
Rien You forgot...
Rien ... to unfreeze me.
Location: ???
Rational and Brilliant Faust ... It has been some time since one such means of oral communication was engaged.
Unbending, Proactive, and Resourceful Faust This macabre atmosphere... It seems the congregation this time is in the form of levitating stones. A fitting representation for the discussion of serious agenda... However, there are no subjects that rise to such gravity at present.
August and Dignified Faust Which Faust is the audacious Faust that dared to force-convene a "Classical Walpurgisnacht" at such a busy moment as this?
Lovely and Guileful Faust It is unimaginable that such an ignorant and tactless Faust should exist among Fausts... save for "Naive Faust."
Naive Faust? …….
Lovely and Guileful Faust Oh, my. It really was her.
Naive Faust? Yes. This meeting has been convened by Naive Faust. There is a question that begs the answer of Administrator Fausts of the Gesellschaft management.
Rational and Brilliant Faust ... Rational and Brilliant Faust knows what it is that Naive Faust seeks to ask...
Rational and Brilliant Faust ... as well as the fact that there is no real need for the query concerned to be set forth.
Astute and Intelligent Faust *sigh* How long must Faust spoon-feed Naive Faust?
August and Dignified Faust Let it be heard, at the very least.
Naive Faust? …….
Naive Faust? The attempt to review information on the recent incident at the House of Spiders was met with denials of access at multiple turns.
Naive Faust? Requesting access to intelligence on the individual who has deliberately compromised the security of Limbus Company's HQ.
Astute and Intelligent Faust Could Naive Faust not even manage to answer such a trivial query herself? Must Astute and Intelligent Faust provide every single piece of information?
August and Dignified Faust There is no obligation to disclose more information to a Faust of such inferior access rights.
Unbending, Proactive, and Resourceful Faust Surely Naive Faust has not forgotten how access rights work?
Naive Faust? Reviewing Gesellschaft's information requires access rights that are several tiers higher, yes.
Naive Faust? What I mea—what Faust means to say is...
Rational and Brilliant Faust A thoroughly intentional slip of the tongue. To refer to Faust in the first-person is strictly prohibited.
Lovely and Guileful Faust Naive Faust has long been known to show... quite a precarious side.
August and Dignified Faust Hmm. Does Naive Faust wish to join the ranks of dead Fausts?
Naive Faust? *sigh* Of course not. Faust does not wish to join the ranks of dead Fausts. Faust is simply curious.
Unbending, Proactive, and Resourceful Faust There is no information to be granted to Naive Faust, who time and again has attempted to leech off the Gesellschaft.
Lovely and Guileful Faust Lovely and Guileful Faust can offer an answer. In return, however, Naive Faust must consent to have her title changed. Is this acceptable?
Naive Faust? ... It is accepted.
Lovely and Guileful Faust The answer is Dias, the Chief Executive Director of Limbus Company, Stupid Faust.
Stupid Faust? ... The sharing of information is appreciated.
Astute and Intelligent Faust To think that Stupid Faust would go so far as to convene a Classical Walpurgisnacht for a query that requires only the least effort of deductive reasoning.
Astute and Intelligent Faust The new title could not be more appropriate for Stupid Faust.
Stupid Faust? …….
Lovely and Guileful Faust Could it be that Stupid Faust is indignant? *chuckle* She seems to be expressing displeasure by means of silence.
August and Dignified Faust Such is the price for requesting so much information as a Faust of a non-administrative role.
Stupid Faust? In that case, if Faust were to—
Rational and Brilliant Faust No need to build on impossible hypotheticals.
Rational and Brilliant Faust Although it is a fact that Stupid Faust has retrieved the most Golden Boughs, she cannot be reinstated as an administrator Faust.
Unbending, Proactive, and Resourceful Faust Still, if Stupid Faust were to plant the sapling and harvest an apple from it... who knows? She might have a chance of becoming an administrator again.
Lovely and Guileful Faust *scoff* Can Stupid Faust even accomplish such a feat? It sounds improbable... What does Stupid Faust think?
Stupid Faust? That's...
August and Dignified Faust Enough. The time and floor granted to Stupid Faust have come to a close. Stupid Faust shall be dismissed from the Gesellschaft Forum forthwith.
Unbending, Proactive, and Resourceful Faust The Classical Walpurgisnacht is thus forcibly adjourned.
Location: -1
Location: N Corp.
Nelly Madam Director. I have some updates to report on Limbus Company.
Hermann Do tell.
Nelly First, Limbus Company's Golden Bough grafting experiments have finally succeeded. Only five more Boughs left to be retrieved, and...
Hermann And the sapling will be planted. It won't be long now.
Nelly Next, the LCB's 11th Sinner—Sinclair's "Sign"... has completely awakened, though only for a moment.
Sonya That's interesting indeed. I thought it'd take a few more years.
Sonya Did all three strokes manifest?
Nelly The Signs aren't visible to me, so I cannot say with much certainty... But I don't believe he has. It was most likely just a... short-lived awakening.
Hermann They say an accomplished butler's resourcefulness rivals that of a Fixer in Seven Association's Section 1... The speed and accuracy of your information-gathering is indeed commendable. Anything else I should be aware of?
Nelly Yes. Lastly... Your son's royal-blood gene factor has also awakened.
Gubo The "factor," huh... Does that mean your son has finally unwrapped what you gave him?
Hermann No.
Hermann The Roach Emperor is but another layer of wrappings, if a bit fancier than the others.
Hermann He has yet to unwrap the valuable, precious gift I've given him.
Hermann But it may not be long now. The real surprise gift will begin from the mistletoe that will bud from the sapling.
Aseah By the way, where's the captain? I haven't seen her around since H Corp.
Nelly Ah, she should be whetting her harpoon for the Whale-hunting. She asked to call her and her crew only once the hunt begins.
Jia Huan Hah... How long will we be stuck in this pure-white building?
Hermann ... For now, we will focus on restoring the Xianhuang Worm and interpreting its interactions in this place. Although circumstances might change fast once the upcoming N Corp. board meeting concludes.
Hermann Speaking of, Sonya... Have you looked into what I asked?
Sonya Yes, the infiltrator agents reported back just yesterday. Heinrich Kromer and Jacob—both are confirmed to attend the board meeting.
Hermann It's a hassle to deal with people who make even the simplest of conversations a nuisance... But I won't deny that this bodes well.
Sonya If the same Heinrich, who didn't even budge when the younger Kromer was killed, is finally making a move... I suppose it's just around the corner now.
Hermann Indeed. It won't be long before the Malleus Maleficarum's roster is finalized.
Hermann A hunt for prosthetic users, the likes of which the City has never seen, will soon begin. Even the Machine Purge would look downright tame in comparison.
Hermann And we'll use that chaos...
Aseah ... to aim for every Mirror World in existence.
Jia Huan Hah. The captain will love that. It'll be like going on a Whale hunt across all possible worlds herself.
Sonya Perhaps we should wrap up our talk here and head inside. It's time.
Hermann Of course. Nelly, keep an eye on Limbus Company until your next assignment.
Nelly Yes, Madam Director.
Hermann Choose your words and actions carefully once the board meeting begins. Even the slightest misstep could tip the balance and put us at a disadvantage—that's another headache we don't need.
Gubo I must admit, it's rather unnerving to have to deal with the infamous Ones Who Grip in their own Nest.
Hermann All right, then... Shall we head inside?
